loans.name: Al Basem 50198 Group

texts.en:
Rouweida is the featured representative of Al Basem 50198 group. She and the other group members are best friends, which led them to get together to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua.

Rouweida is a 36-year-old married mother of three. She works at a neighborhood school with her husband, who is a security guard. Since they’ve been struggling to keep up with their family’s growing expenses, Rouweida decided to establish her own business selling beauty products and crafts. After six years in business, she’s been able to acquire a good reputation among her customers.

Rouweida is an ambitious woman who has successfully completed five previous loan cycles with Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. She is now acquiring a loan to repair her apartment in order to provide her family with a more comfortable home. Rouweida is standing on the right side of the picture next to Wafaa, while Ikram is wearing the purple top and Rana is on the left.

loans.use: To repair her apartment

loans.name: Parasakthi-Palijiyanallur Shg Group

texts.en:
Palinjiyanallur is a small village in Trichy district. Seven women from the village have formed a Self Help Group which is called “Parasakthi” SHG.  Shantha is the leader of the group. They have been receiving microfinance loans from “PAT” for the last five years and they are repaying them successfully. 

Shantha is living with her husband, Mr. Marudhakasu, and three children. Her husband is a farmer. The family is living in their own house. Shantha has studied till 5th grade and now she is involved in cultivation activity in her own lands.  

Shantha (who is sitting in the picture) and six other members are seeking a loan to buy a smokeless stove. Currently all members are using conventional firewood stoves, and these stoves produce a lot of smoke which is affecting the health of family members. All members have planned to buy Greenway Smart (smokeless) stoves because they are single-burner, high-efficiency cookstoves designed for long-term, everyday use. The stove can use any type of solid biomass fuel, producing 70% less smoke and using 65% less fuel than traditional mud cook stoves.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto  grado, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura,  tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 están en la escuela.


Sandra  se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 11 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres que desde siempre han cultivado, ahora al ver la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, Sandra tuvo que involucrarse a trabajar con su esposo y juntos realizan las actividades agrícolas, el terreno donde ella cultiva le queda a una distancia de  20 minutos y viaja a pie, Sandra se levanta des muy temprano para preparar el desayuno de su esposo y el de los niños para mandarlos a la escuela.



El préstamo que está solicitando lo necesita para comprar dos sacos de abono para la milpa, ya que es momento de abonarla.



sus sueños son tener salud siempre para ayudarle a su compañero de vida a sembrar pues es el medio con el cual sobreviven, y espera a poyar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sandra is 32 years old and completed up to sixth grade at school. She currently has a partner, who works in farming. Sandra has four children, three of whom are in school.

Sandra has been working in farming for eleven years. She learned this trade from her parents who always grew crops. Now, seeing a need to prosper with her family, Sandra had to involve herself in her husband's work. Together the couple do their farming work. The couple's land is 20 minutes away, and they arrive their by foot. Sandra wakes up very early to prepare breakfast for her husband, and for her children before they go to school.

Sandra needs this loan to buy two bags of manure for her cornfield, as it is now time to lay the manure.

Sandra's dreams are to keep up her health in order to help her life-partner sow crops; this work is how the couple survive. Sandra hopes to support her children so that they will study at university.

loans.use: to buy two bags of manure for her cornfield.

loans.name: José Santos Virgilio

texts.es:
José de 62 años de edad, es un agricultor que estudió hasta sexto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios  domésticos, tiene 8  hijos pero 6 de ellos están en hogares apartes y los otros dos viven en casa, además otros dos nietos y todos ellos dependen de José


José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, su padrino lo llevaba al trabajo y así fue como aprendió, el lugar de trabaja le queda a 15 minutos de su casa y se va a pie, sos hijos y los nietos se involucran en el trabajo y le ayudan cuando llegan de estudiar, la actividad la realizan de 6:00 AM a 12:00 del MD.


El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar 6 sacos de abono y también pagar para que le piquen el sacate con una máquina, ya que necesita alimentar al ganado.


Su sueño es seguir cultivando la tierra para que a su familia no les falte nada en la casa y enseñarle mas a sus nietos sobre el trabajo agrícola.
texts.en:
José, 62 years old, is a farmer who studied up to the sixth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the domestic chores. He has 8 children but 6 live in separate houses and the other two live in at home, in addition to another two grandchildren, and all of them depend on José.

José has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old; his godfather brought him to work and this was how he learned it. The place where he works is 15 minutes from his house and he goes by foot. His children and grandchildren are involved in the work and help him when they come from school. They do the work from 6:00 AM to 12:00 midday.

The requested loan is needed to purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer and also to pay for someone to grind the forage with a machine, since he needs to feed the livestock. 

His dream is to continue cultivating the land so his family doesn't lack anything in the home and to teach his grandchildren more about agricultural work.

loans.use: to purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer and also to pay for someone to grind the forage with a machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Servillana

texts.en:
Arcel is 17 years old and the first of four children in the family. His mother Servillana supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Arcel is studying for the degree of Bachelor of Science in Commerce and is currently in his first year of this four-year course.

Servillana, Arcel's mother, is borrowing 8,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Arcel plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Solidario Mariposas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Solidario Mariposas de San Bartolo
Este grupo está formado por doña Julia Felisa, ella tiene 41 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de consumo diario como azúcar, pan, cereales, leche, arroz, y por las tardes venta de refacciones en la escuela local de san Bartolomé Milpas Altas , ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de abarrotes para surtir su tienda, y la otra parte la necesita para surtir su otra tienda que se ubica en la escuelita local , con el deseo de ofrecer mas productos a los alumnos y surtirles más la refacción.
texts.en:
Mariposas de San Bartolo solidarity group
This group is formed by Julia Felisa. She is 41 years old and works selling daily food such as sugar, bread, grains, milk, rice, and in the afternoons she sells snacks at a local school in San Bartolomé Milpas Altas. She is asking for this loan to invest in purchasing supplies to stock her store, and the other part is needed to stock her other store which is located in the little local school, with the hope of offering more products to the students and furnishing them with more snacks.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is 60 years old, a widower, and a resident of Baybay Maningcol, Ozamiz City, Philippines. He is blessed with three children. He is engaged in selling. He started a sari-sari store with 3,000 PHP in capital. His primary customers are his neighbors. He was able to manage the store well and able to finance the daily needs of his family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, which he became a member of in June 2014. Now, he is applying for a loan of 30,000 PHP to restock the store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. He is looking forward to expanding his sari-sari into a minimart someday.

loans.use: to restock the store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Iris

texts.en: Iris operates a food-production business, making and selling longaniza (meat sausage) to earn a living. She has been with her business for three years and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. Recently, she took out a new loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare longaniza to sell. She is planning to improve the business, for she wants a better future for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare longaniza (meat sausage) to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay labourers to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.pt:
O senhor Patrίcio é avicultor, casado, pai de 5 filhos dos quais 3 estudam e 2 ainda menores vive na casa prépria e sustenta 1 irmāo que vive com ele.
Diz que com este valor irá comprar pintos, rações e vitaminas para a sua criaçāo tem um pavilhāo com capacidade para 2000 pintos.
Para o futuro pretende crescer no seu negócio  fazer mais um pavilhāo 
Diz que ira solicitar mais empréstimos  para concretizar seus planos. Além desta actividade ele dedica se a agricultura conta nesta actividade com ajuda de sua esposo.
texts.en:
Patrício is a poultry farmer. He's married and has five children, three of whom go to school and two are still too young. He lives in a house that he owns and he supports his brother who lives with him.
He states that with this loan he'll purchase chicks, feed and vitamins for his chicken farm. He owns an aviary that can house up to 2000 chicks.
In the future he hopes to expand his business by building another aviary.
He states that he'll request more loan so he can achieve his plans. Aside from this business, he works in agriculture and gets help from his wife.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins for his chicken farm.

loans.name: Ageteraine Farmers Group-Kaburaisoke

texts.en: Gilbert is a hardworking married man, age 42, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He farms to supplement his retail business, which he started in 1992 to earn income to enhance his living standard. Gilbert is hoping for prosperity despite his business facing the threat of competition from similar businesses. Gilbert intends to use credit to buy general merchandise to sell, such as salt, cooking oil, and soap. He is a member of Ageteraine Farmers Group-Kaburaisoke, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan, since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell, such as salt, cooking oil, and soap

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn is a new member of Paglaum Multipurpose Cooperative.  She wishes to avail herself of the various products and services of the Cooperative.  She and her husband have been full-time tricycle operators for 10 years already. They have five children, and four of them go to school. Now, she is applying for a loan to finance the repair of their motorcycle and the renewal of the annual registration. Her plan after this loan is to change her motorcycle unit into a new one and get an additional one for long-lasting operation, which will lead to a higher quality of life and help their children's future.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle repair and renewal of registration

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a married Ugandan man with three children, and two attend school. He operates a mobile money business and gets a monthly salary, this being his additional income. He started this business to support and sustain himself. He needs a loan for construction purposes. He hopes to open up more branches of mobile money-distribution points in other towns and the neighboring districts so as to increase his income levels. However, he has been limited by inadequate capital and the ever-increasing losses.

loans.use: to perform construction

loans.name: Ayabavi

texts.fr:
Ayabavi est âgée de 34 ans, divorcée  et mère de deux(02) enfants. Elle vend depuis 2012  des produits de premières nécessités et des condiments dans son quartier à Cassablanca. 

Ayabavi s’approvisionne en œuf, et autres condiments  deux fois par mois  au marché de Gbossimé  et  revend au bord de la route.

Ayabavi  sollicite ce microcrédit pour agrandir son commerce et répondre aux besoins des clients afin de tirer plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ayabavi is 34 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children. She has been selling necessities and condiments since 2012 in her district in Cassablanca. 

Ayabavi gets her supplies of eggs and other condiments once a month at the Gbossimé market and resells them on the roadside. 

She is requesting this microloan to expand her business and respond to customer needs in order to earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 4 containers of vegetable oil, 5 trays of eggs, and 2 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: El mayor orgullo de un colombiano es sin duda hincharse su pecho y decir esa casa la estoy construyendo con mis propias esfuerzos y es que esto es un motivo de orgullo desbordante para una persona y más de Alexander un humilde vendedor de comidas quien sueña con terminar se construir su casa para dejarle un herencia a su bella hija de tan solo 8 años de edad y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para adecuar su carro de comidas, también para la compra de sillas para atender a personas discapacitadas o en embarazo, pagara impuestos e invertirá en surtido con el ánimo de terminar de construir su casa y poder brindarle a su amada hija una educación de calidad
texts.en: Any Colombian's greatest pride is in saying that he is building his house through his own efforts. This is an important source of joy for anyone, including for humble food-seller Alexander. Alexander dreams of finishing building his house so that he may leave it to his beautiful eight-year-old daughter. In order to achieve, this dream, Alexander is applying for a loan in order to adapt his food cart, and to buy seats in order to serve disabled and pregnant customers. Alexander will also use this loan to pay taxes and to invest in stock so that he can finish building his house and provide his much-loved daughter with a good quality of education.

loans.use: to adapt his food cart, pay taxes, and to stock up his business in order to earn enough money to finish building his house.

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr:
Alima est âgée de  43 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle vend depuis 1998 des piments écrasés. Alima s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché de Gbossimé et  revend ses produits une fois produites aussi  au marché.
Alima  sollicite un microcrédit lui permettra d'acheter 45 bols de piments sec pour agrandir son commerce et faire plus de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Alima is 43 years old and the married mother of four. She has been selling chili peppers flakes since 1998. She gets her supplies once a month at the Gbossimé market and resells her products there also. 

Alima is requesting a microloan enabling her to purchase 45 bowls of dried chili peppers to expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 45 bowls of dried chili peppers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a display case, chairs and stock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cart with a fryer, an awning, chairs, and work supplies.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam esta casada tiene dos hijos y vive en alquiler en la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, se dedica a la venta de mani blanco y mani tostado molido.

El credito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder comprar mas mercaderia (mani) y no perder clientela ya que ella vende en la calle y es muy conocida. La calidad de su producto es excelente y la demanda por emismo ha mejorado notablemente. El dinero también sera usado para comprar una maquina moledora
texts.en:
Miriam is married; she has two children, and lives in rented accommodation of the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. Miriam makes a living selling toasted, ground up peanuts.

This loan will be used to increase capital and to buy more merchandise (peanuts) and not lose customers. Miriam sells her products in the street and is very well-known. She offers very good quality products and demand is increased significantly. This loan will also be used to buy a grinder.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and a grinder.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela, vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de San martin de la ciudad de La Paz.esta soltera  y no tiene hijos, tiene un microbus con el cual genera sus ingresos para su mantencion.

El credito que solicita es para poner en buen estado el motor de su vehiculo y comprar algunos accesorios para que funcione mejor.

Gisela es una unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar
texts.en:
Gisela lives in her parents' house in the San Martin area of La Paz.  She is single and has no children.  She has a "microbus" (minibus), which she uses to earn the money she needs to maintain it. 

The loan she is requesting is to get her vehicle's motor into good working order and to buy some accessories so that it runs better. 

Gisela is the only wage-earner in her home.

loans.use: to get her vehicle into good working order and purchase accessories for it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bigger concrete mixer for his construction work.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 63 years old, a widow and a resident of Bitoon Aguada Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is blessed with 3 children. She started a sari-sari (mini- grocery) store with a capital of 5,000 PHP. Her primary customers are her neighbors. She has been able to manage the store well and was able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative, which she became a member in 2007. She was able to avail herself of 4 loans and repaid them religiously. Now, she applies for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a display case and supplies to open a stationery shop in her business which will complement her internet cafe services.

loans.name: Kigunda Abeteraine Group

texts.en: Serina is a 42-year-old, married lady living in Kagadi-Uganda with two children attending school. She sells produce like beans, maize and ground nuts, and does farming to improve her household income and to educate her children. She hopes to grow her business and educate her children despite poor transportion causing delays in delivery of goods to customers. Serina is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans for selling. She is a member of Kigunda Abeteraine Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 56 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 adult children. 
Paulina has been engaged in the hog fattening business for the last 5 years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. Her husband earns income from their iron grill manufacturing business. She has requested a loan to purchase 4 piglets and 3 sacks of booster and grower feed for her hog fattening business. 
Paulina has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Paulina hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: To purchase 4 piglets and 3 sacks of booster and grower feed

loans.name: Juan Martir

texts.es:
Juan tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta 2do grado está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está en la escuela y dependen de Juan.


Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años, este trabajo se lo enseñó su padre para que en un futuro se defendiera a través del trabajo agrícola, lo hace de un horario de la 6 am a las 12 del medio dia 


El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas, comprará 6 sacos de abono, esto le ayudará mucho porque podrá tener segura su producción.


Su sueño es que Dios le preste vida para poder seguir cultivando la tierra y así salir adelante con sus hijos y prepararlos dedicadamente para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old. He studied up to the second grade, is partnered, and his partner takes care of the household chores. He has 2 children, one of whom is a student, and they depend on Juan.  

Juan has worked in agriculture for the past 8 years. His father taught him this work so that in the future he could hold his own with farm work, which he does on a schedule of 6:00 am to 12:00 midday.

The requested loan is needed to purchase agricultural supplies, he will purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer. This will help him a lot because he will be able to secure his production. 

His dream is that God grant him life to be able to continue farming the land and in this way get ahead with his children and prepare them with dedication so they become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies, he will purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Yawa Enyonam

texts.fr:
Âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et  mère de deux (02) enfants dans le quartier  de Cassablanca. Couturière de formation elle est rentrée depuis 2009 dans le commerce en vendant des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au grand marché et la revend  à la maison. 
Elle sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: At 40 years of age, she is a married mother of two in the Cassablanca district. A seamstress by training, she returned to doing commerce in general goods in 2009. She gets her supplies twice a month at the big market and resells her products at her house. She is requesting a loan to expand her business in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 10 rolls of lining and 6 packets of thread for sewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for his shop.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Âgée de 33 ans, mariée et  mère de trois enfants à Cassablanca, Julienne vendait de la bouillie de 2007 à 2010. Depuis trois ans, elle commence la vente des bijoux. Julienne s’approvisionne une fois par mois depuis Tokpa au BENIN et les revend à Lomé.
Julienne sollicite un microcrédit  pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire de plus de bénéfice.
texts.en: A 33-year-old married mother of three in Cassablanca, Julienne used to sell porridge from 2007 to 2010. Three years ago, she started selling jewelry. She gets her supplies once a month from Tokpa in BENIN and resells them in Lomé. She is requesting this microloan to expand her business in order to earm more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 16 dozen pieces of jewelry and 5 bracelets

loans.name: Dayana

texts.es:
Dayana es comerciante y vive en la casa de sus padres en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento, en la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que es el único sustento de ella y su hijo. Dayana vende frazadas, edredones, buzos deportivos en forma  ambulatoria (no tiene lugar fijo de ventas)

No obstante, Dayana se ha dado modos de ir a la universidad y ahora quiere un credito para pagar los tramites que involucra hacer su tesis Su padre la ayuda pero eso no alcanza por eso ella necesita de su ayuda
texts.en:
Dayana is a merchant and lives in her parents' home, made of brick with a cement floor, in the city of La Paz. She works for more than eight hours a day and is the only one who sustains herself and her child. Dayana sells blankets, quilts, and tracksuits as a street vendor (she doesn't have a fixed sales location).

All the same, Dayana has given herself the means to go to university and now she wants a loan to pay the fees that are involved in doing her thesis. Her father helps her but this is not sufficient. So, she needs the help of the loan.

loans.use: to pay the fees that are involved in her thesis.

loans.name: Laura

texts.pt:
A dona Laura é viuva māe de 2 filhas já maiores de idade e sustenta 4 netos que vivem com ela e é avicultora ha mais de 10 anos, na sua casa tem um pavilhāo com a capacidade para 400 frangos.
Com o valor irá comprar pintos, rações, vacinas, vitaminas para reforçar a suas criação.
Diz que tem como planos para o futuro crescer no seu negócio, terminar sua obra e voltar a prestar serviços de costura num estabelecimento próprio para reforçar a renda familiar.
Além desta actividade dedica se também a agricultura tem machambas onde faz cultivo de diversas culturas. Irá pagar pontualmente e solicitar mais para concretizar seus planos.
texts.en:
Laura is a widow. She has two daughters who are already adults and she supports four grandchildren who live with her. She has been a poultry farmer for over 10 years. At her house she has an aviary that can house up to 400 chickens.
With this loan she'll purchase chicks, feed, vaccines and vitamins in order to stock her chicken farm.
She states that her plans for the future are to expand her business and finish the construction work. She also plans to go back to working as a dressmaker in a shop of her own so that she can improve her family's income.
Aside from this business, she also works in agriculture. She owns a farm where she sows various crops. She'll repay the loan in a timely fashion and apply for more in order to achieve her plans.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, vaccines and vitamins in order to stock her chicken farm.

loans.name: Semuel

texts.en:
Semuel is a 36-year-old man who is married to Kamili, a 36-year-old woman. They are blessed with four children, named Ise (11), Yuda (7), Belbi (3) and Senta (1). Ise and Yuda are in elementary school and the other two are not yet in school.

Semuel is a security guard officer at a university near where he lives. In order to generate extra income for his family, Semuel initiated a pig breeding business two years ago, purchasing two piglets with his savings. The reason he initiated this business was the realization that he will one day retire from his current job, while still needing to pay for his children's tuition.

Semuel needs a loan for his business improvement. He wants to build a permanent stall for the safety of his pigs, but does not have much cash for it. Therefore he requests a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on the materials to build the permanent stall, such as cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.use: to buy the materials to build a permanent stall, such as cement, sands, and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth and shoes to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 56 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children, now at their adult age. Daisy has been engaged in a hog fattening business for five years. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing two piglets, three sacks of booster, and growers feed for her hog fattening business. Daisy has been a member of PMPC for 14 years. In the future, Daisy hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets, three sacks of booster, and growers feed.

loans.name: Tweimukye Nkenda Group

texts.en: Joseph, a married man, has worked at selling produce since 1992 and farming to look after his family in Kagadi Uganda. Though his business is challenged by price fluctuations causing instability in his income, he is hopeful that his business will expansion due to the fact that he is hard working. Joseph is requesting for a loan to buy beans and maize for resale. He is a member of Tweimukye Nkenda where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Katikengeye Tulibamwe Group

texts.en: Keti is 48 years old, married with 8 children aged between 22 and 5 years and living in Kagadi Uganda. She gets her income from selling produce since 2004 and farming for extra income. She plans to buy a plot of land despite her business lacking enough capital for expansion and to increase her earnings. Keti is hardworking and she is asking for a loan to buy beans for resale. She is a member of Katikengeye Tulibamwe Group, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities

loans.use: to buy beans for resale

loans.name: Baikazi Kweterana Group

texts.en: Francis is a 42-year-old married man operating a retail shop since 1992 in Kagadi Uganda. He also carries on farming to supplement his income. However, in farming he is challenged by price fluctuations of agricultural products that make his incomes unstable. Since Francis is hardworking, he is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, soap, flour and salt to sell. He is a member of Baikazi Kweterana Group where each member guarantees the others to get a loan since they don’t offer any securities.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, soap, flour and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for efficient and clean-cooking liquefied petroleum gas energy.

loans.name: Jijigee

texts.en:
Mr. Jijigee is a 60-year-old college librarian in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been doing his job for many years. He lives with his wife, and their children have moved out.

His youngest son lives on his plot of land in his own house. His other son works at the vacuum window factory and is very experienced. Now Mr. Jijgee wants to install his own vacuum window workshop (on his plot of land) with his son to have their own business. For this he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugrigs). He will use the loan to buy some equipment for his vacuum window workshop.

loans.use: to buy some equipment for his vacuum window workshop.

loans.name: Gibson

texts.pt:
O senhor Gibson  é pensionista militar, casado, pai de 3 filhos já maiores vive na casa própria e sustenta 2 netos enviando.
Ele diz que com este valor irá comprar chapas de zinco e cimento para sua obra ela já vive na casa.
No futuro tem como planos fazer o muro de vedaçāo de seu quintal e uma loja para reforçar a renda familiar a esposa  irá trabalhar na loja.
Diz que ira pagar conforme o calendario e solicitar mais emprestimos e que alem  da pensao tem machambas onde pratica o cultivo de diversos tipos de produtos que servem de refoco para a renda familia.
texts.en:
Gibson is a military pensioner. He's married and has three children who are already adults. He lives in a house that he owns and supports two grandchildren.
He states that with this loan he'll purchase zinc sheets and cement for doing construction work on the house he already lives in.
His plans for the future are to build a fence wall around his yard and also a store in order to improve his family's income. His wife will work in the store.
He states that he'll repay the loan according to the schedule and he'll request more loans. Aside from receiving the pension, he owns a farm where he grows various types of produce that contribute to his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheets and cement in order to do construction work on his house.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Filipinos have been "balut" (unhatched eggs)-lovers over the years. Hence, Jocelyn has this business opportunity to produce this product with the balut-making process. Supplies of fresh eggs should be maintained, specifically duck eggs. The eggs are incubated and are harvested after 16 to 18 days, before they hatch in the incubator. The harvested balut will then be delivered to different balut retailers. Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years. The business helps her to support of her family. She has one dependent child who is college level now. She was requesting a loan with the same purpose of her prior loan, to buy ducks for producing eggs.  She will be able save, by not having to buy fresh eggs from outside sellers who maintain their own ducks. Therefore, the production of balut could be stable, since she would already have fresh eggs. The ducks are transported to the rice fields at the end of every harvest so that they can feed. The eggs will be brought to where the incubator is located.

loans.use: to pay for additional ducks for her business.

location.town: Dipolog - Bandera, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, 59, is married with three adult-age children. 

Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. 

Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.

La socia Julieta tiene 32 años tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche  entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar entre otros.


La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Julieta is a member of the KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Echarate, in La Convención province, Cusco department.

Julieta is 32 years old, has 3 children and is partnered. She divides her time between her daily chores and working in her business of selling groceries; she sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among others. She has worked for quite some time in this business which is going well thanks to the dedication she puts into her business every day, being that in this way she gets ahead with her family. This loan is part of Asociación Arariwa's line of credit called Credi Yapa; this line of credit is offered to borrowers with a good credit history.

She asks for the loan to purchase sugar among other things.

She is thankful for the offered loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase sugar among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material such as cement and tiles among other things

loans.name: Harwoma Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Jack is a married man with five children, living in Kyenjojo Uganda. He sells soda, sugar, beer, salt and spirits among other things. He earns additional income from a banana plantation business, but experiences low turnout of customers and pricing fluctuations. His vision is to be economically okay as he plans for the proceeds from his business. Jack needs the loan to buy spirits, sodas and beer to sell.

Jack is a member of the Harwoma Abagambakamu Group, where it is Hofokam culture for members to guarantee each other, as they don't offer security.

loans.use: to buy spirits, soda, and beer to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lab equipment with reagents to use in his laboratory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for affordable and clean-cooking liquefied petroleum gas energy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clean-cooking and affordable liquefied petroleum gas cooking energy.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay is a true San Diego original. Way back in grade school, Jay made a name for himself among his classmates by painting denim jackets and selling them for $20. Jay enjoyed the recognition his peers gave him for his artistic ability, which led him at the age of 14 to broaden his skills by working for a silk-screener after school. It was here that Jay started building what would become the foundation of his future business, DyseOne.

Jay and his brother grew up without a father figure. Raised by a single mother, they spent their free time pursuing the dream of being street artists, trawling the San Diego streets late at night looking for virgin walls upon which they could present their artistic vision.  Unfortunately the authorities did not look kindly on their use of public space, arresting Jay several times and eventually sending him to Juvenile Detention. 

With time to think, Jay realized that it was not fun going to jail for painting on walls, and that by using different avenues to present his art, he could better serve both his own interests and the interests of the community. On July 9, 2007, Jay formed DyseOne, a clothing company representing the culmination of a lifetime of skill-honing and preparation.

For Jay, serving his local community and maintaining artistic integrity were always more important than profit-seeking. It is for this reason that Jay continues to keep his price points low.

 “I cater to the not so fortunate, the street-wear market,” said Jay. “I keep prices low so the people from the neighborhood I grew up in can afford it.” 

Jay will use his Kiva loan to purchase inventory to expand his already profitable and growing business, with an established network of wholesale distributors in Spain and Australia, as well as through orders coming in from Ross Dress for Less and the Burlington Coat Factory.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to expand his already profitable and growing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and available cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 34-year-old male, single with no children and living in Kasese ,Uganda. He has been practicing agriculture for five years. He is a primary school teacher and earns a salary as additional income. He began commercial agriculture to have a better standard of living. Godfrey is hard working, but has little capital to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor in order to improve his productivity and have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Elisio

texts.pt:
O senhor Elίsio trabalha como auxiliar da via na empresa de caminhos de ferro é casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estudam 1 ainda menor, vive na casa própria não sustenta mais ninguém além seus filhos.
Com o valor do crédito irá comprar cimento, pedra, areia barrotes para dar continuidade a construção de sua casa que encontra se na fase da cobertura e colocaçāo de janelas. 
Diz que no futuro  quer  oficializar sua relaçāo marital, comprar uma viatura para uso pessoal e aluguer para reforcar a renda familiar.
Irá pagar pontualmente e solicitar mais empréstimos para a concretizaçāo deste sonho.
texts.en:
Elísio works as an assistant operator for a railroad company. He's married and has three children, two of whom go to school and one is still too young. He lives in a house that he owns and doesn't support anyone else other than his children.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement, rocks, sand and beams so he can continue building his house. He's currently putting up a roof and installing the windows.
He states that in the future he wishes to make his marriage official and to buy a vehicle for personal use and also for renting out as a way of improving his family's income.
He will repay the loan in a timely fashion and request more loans in order to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks, sand and beams so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clean and affordable cooking gas from liquefied petroleum

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, is 49, married and blessed with four children. She has managed a hog raising business in their village for almost 20 years and earns a net income of PHP 10,000 for every four hogs that she sells. Due to insufficient capital in her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase a supply of hog feed. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of hog feed.

loans.name: Maisah

texts.en: Maisah, a daughter of a carpenter and a housekeeper, one way or another wants to finish her studies in order to augment their future living. She is studying in a university for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan to pay her school tuition fees for the first semester.  She hopes to finish her studies to become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees.

loans.name: Constantino

texts.pt:
O senhor Constantino é pensionista, casado, vive na casa própria pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 já maiores e 1 a estudar além deste sustenta 4 sobrinhos que não vivem com ela apenas enviam lhes dinheiro.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar aros para as janelas e portas, rebocar a casa e começar a fazer a fossa para sua casa de banho interna.
Tem como sonho terminar com as obras, mobilar a casa, fazer um muro de vedação para o seu quintal  e oficializar sua relação.
Compromete se a pagar pontualmente conforme o calendário estabelecido e diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Constantino is a pensioner. He's married and lives in a house that he owns. He has three children, two of whom are already adults and one is in school. Aside from this child, he supports four nephews, but they don't live with him - he only sends them money.
He states that with the amount of the loan he'll purchase frames for the windows and doors, plaster the house and start building a cesspit for his indoor bathroom.
His dream is to finish the construction work, furnish the house, build a fence wall around his yard and make his marriage official.
He pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion, according to the scheduled timeframe. He states that he'll apply for more loans so he can accomplish his projects.

loans.use: to purchase frames for the windows and doors, plaster the house and start building a cesspit for his indoor bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase perfumes, shoes, and cloth to sell

loans.name: La Foi De Aculesamedi Group

texts.fr:
Delima est le coordinateur de son groupe La Foi de Aculesamedi. Il n'est pas mariee. Il habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de L'éau portable est très limité. Il dirige son commerce de vente de du charbon pendants les 10 derniers années. Avant de ce commercé ce commerce Il était enseignant. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. 

Des autres membres de La Foi de Aculesamedi ont besoin d'un emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, produit alimentaires, charbon, etc. Il dit que son défit principal est de devenir un plus grand commerçant Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir une plus grande commerce qui lui facilitera à voyagé dans des autre pays tel que panama.
texts.en:
Delima is the coordinator of his group La Foi de Aculesamedi. He is not married. He lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. Delima has been running his business selling charcoal for the last ten years. Before starting this business, he was a teacher. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. 

Other members of La Foi de Aculesamedi have need of a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetic products, soft drinks, grocery items, charcoal, etc. 

Delima says that his main challenge is to become a bigger merchant. He says his main goal is to have a bigger business facilitating trips to other countries, such as Panama.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Sahei Group

texts.en:
Kimbem is a resident of Saikul village in Manipur. She is a mother to two daughters and a son. She says that all her hard work and efforts are for her children who she loves unconditionally. She is the featured profile member of “Sahei” group and is pictured with her hand raised.
  
Her husband is a policeman in the Manipur Police Department. He is the sole breadwinner of the family. Kimbem is a housewife. Although she doesn't engage in a specific profession, she gives her best effort in raising her kids. Her children are still young and they need her special attention, says Kimbem. She takes care of their daily schedule and household chores. Like every mother, she wishes for her kids to have decent careers and become successful in the future.

Kimbem wanted a loan for a solar home lighting system for her children to have a better study environment as well as for household use.  As the power supply is irregular and unreliable in the village, a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system that will light four bulbs for 12 hours a day, can help her kids to study for longer hours. She believes that since the lighting products are bright, it will provide conducive luminance for reading and help them to study better. Their schoolwork will improve and their eyesight will be safeguarded when they study by solar-powered light instead of conventional alternative lighting device like candles, kerosene lamps and petromax.
 
She says thank you Kiva for the generous help towards her and the group. Likewise, her group members need solar loans for their respective income-generating activities and for their children's study purposes.

loans.use: To buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: Molly is a hardworking, 44-year-old woman, who is married with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She raises livestock and poultry as her main source of income so as to care for her family.  She faces many challenges including diseases that attack her birds and they end up dying. She is aiming to see all of her children succeed in education. She is requesting for a loan to buy more cattle and goats for selling.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and goats for selling.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is a 55-year-old father of four, settled and living in Zamboanga del Sur with his family. He raises pigs to gain income in order to provide for the needs of his family. Currently, Mario has joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to buy additional piglets. He usually sells his pigs in town in bulk and with this, he earns more income. In the future, Mario wants to improve his business as well as the general living of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets for his business.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Mr. Otgonbayar, 49 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at the power plant since 2009. His wife works at the trade center. Their elder two sons work and contribute to family income while the younger two go to high school. The house his family lives in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some repair. So he is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned. Burning of coal is considered the biggest contributor to air pollution.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes, cloth, and bags to sell

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
A dona Cacilda é casada, māe de 6 filhos ja maiores da idade e com suas casas vive na casa própria sustenta 1 neta que vive com ela é avicultora, presta serviços de fabrico de blocos e também faz machambas.
Com o valor do crédito ira comprar  pintos, rações e vitaminas para a sua criaçāo. Actulmente trabalha com 200 pintos e quer reforçar a quantidade.
Para o futuro planeia aquisiçāo de um tractor para o cultivo de suas machambas e prestaçāo de serviços a outros agricultores da regiāo o que irá ajudar também na renda familiar.
Diz ainda que compromete se a pagar pontualmente e que irá solicitar mais emprástimos o mais rápido e que no fabrico de blocos conta conta com uma trabalhador sazonal.
texts.en:
Cacilda is married and has six children, all of whom are already adults and have houses of their own. She lives in a house that she owns and supports a granddaughter who lives with her. She's a poultry farmer. She also makes bricks and owns a farm.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase chicks, feed and vitamins for her chicken farm. She currently has 200 chicks and wishes to increase that amount.
In the future she plans to buy a tractor in order to sow on her farm and provide services for other local farmers, which will also contribute to her family's income.
She states that she pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion and that she'll apply for more loans as soon as possible. She also reports that she employs a seasonal worker on her brick making business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed and vitamins for her chicken farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en: Madeline is a hardworking, entrepreneur who has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like body-lotion, perfume, shampoo and other personal products to sell to customers. Madeline has been in this business for six years. She also earns more income from fish vending. Madeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like body-lotion, perfume, shampoo and other personal products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase used clothing and some bottles

loans.name: Dúo Estrellas De Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo estrellas de santo tomas
Este dúo está formado por doña Clemencia ella tiene 43 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de tortillas de lunes a domingo, sábados y domingos venta de tamales, en Santo Tomas Milpas Altas, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de maíz y para la inversión de gas, su propósito es seguir invirtiendo y mejorar el nivel de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
“Estrellas de Santo Tomas” (Stars of Saint Thomas) Group

This group was started by Doña Clemencia, age 43. She sells tortillas Monday through Sunday, but on Saturdays and Sundays, she also sells tamales in Santo Tomas Milpas Altas.

Clemencia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of corn and gas. Her goal is to continue investing and improving her children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas for producing tortillas.

loans.name: Roseta

texts.en: Roseta, a mother of three, earns a living with her lampakanay (a plant) woven products business- selling it in their village and in town. She sells woven products in town and she earns higher amounts and more revenue. She took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional woven products and raw materials to produce and sell lampakanay products. She is hoping to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional woven products and raw materials to produce and sell lampakanay products

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is from Upper Talaban, Sergio Osmena, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 41 years of age. He and his partner have three school-age kids. This year, 2014, he joined Paglaum MPC and he appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. From his desire to help the family, he engaged in selling fish in different barangays in the municipality of Sergio Osmena, Zamboanga del Norte.  His motorcycle is his only source of transportation to reach the different barangays and sell fish. His source of income has existed for two years now. In need of additional working capital, he has requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC for an amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this, he hopes to increase his income to provide for the daily needs of his family.  He is also happy he can support the education of his children, which the main priority of his hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish to sell.

location.town: Upper Talaban, Sergio Osmena, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Khuderbat

texts.en: Mr. Khuderbat, 37 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have been making and selling boots to local people at the market for more than fifteen years. His son began to go to elementary school. He is requesting a loan of 3,600,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a 31-year-old, single Ugandan lady with two children, aged between 11 and 9 years who attend school. She runs a poultry farm as her business, and she is also involved in tailoring and design where she gets her additional income. Her motive for joining the business world was to develop and sustain herself. She needs a loan to buy chicken feed and feeding troughs. Her dream is to educate her children to university. Defaulters and delays in payments are the challenges affecting her performance.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and feeding troughs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for efficient liquefied petroleum gas cooking energy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clean and affordable liquefied petroleum gas cooking energy.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta 3º grado es el segundo de 9 hermanos y tenia que ayudar a sus padres a trabajar, su pareja se dedica a las labores del hogar, sus 2 hijos están estudiando por lo que son 3 personas que dependen de él.



Manuel toda su vida ha trabajado en la agricultura y lo aprendió de sus padres, además trabaja como jornalero, su horario es de 7:00 a 11:00 AM por lo que le queda la tarde para trabajar en otras actividades.


Él solicita el crédito para comprar todos los insumos para la siembra de maíz, pues ya tiene el terreno listo para sembrar.



Los sueños de Manuel son poder darles el estudio a sus 2 hijos para que saquen una carrera profesional y tengan una mejor oportunidad en la vida, y que Dios le siga dando fuerzas para seguir trabajando, sabe que es un reto pero con la ayuda del préstamo lo podrá hacer posible.
texts.en:
Manuel is 40 years old and studied through the third grade. He is the second of nine children and had to help his parents with the work. His partner takes care of the household duties. Manuel also has two children who are studying, so he has three people who are dependent on him.

Manuel has spent his entire life working in agriculture, a trade that he learned from his parents. He also works as a farm laborer. His schedule is from 7:00 A.M. to 11:00 A.M. This frees up his afternoons to work at other jobs.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy all of his supplies for planting corn since the land is already prepared for planting. Manuel dreams of providing an education for his two children so that they can obtain professional degrees. This will allow them to have better opportunities in life. He also hopes that God will give him the strength to continue working. Manuel knows this will be a challenge, but the help of this loan will make it possible.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting corn.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is 59 years old, married and has four children. She is a retail store owner and sells grocery items to the people in her village. She needs to add more merchandise to achieve additional sales but she has insufficient funds. So, she is now asking for additional capital of P 8,000 to buy sardines, bread, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. She hopes to keep selling good products and services and gain more profits to use in time of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy sardines, bread, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 53 years old.  She is married and has eight children. She is a hardworking mother and involved herself in selling fruits, vegetables and yakult ( a probiotic dairy product) in her merchandise. Her income goes for school fees, daily meals and revolving capital in her business. She is now asking for additional capital of P 8,000 to buy more yakult, fruits and vegetables to sell.

Someday she hopes to gain good profits and save for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy more yakult, fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rex

texts.en: Rex cultivates his half hectare of rice field and two hectares of corn farmland. He is thankful because through his hard work and determination he was able to improve his farming business. Now, he wants to keep his farmland productive and that's the reason why he is asking for another loan amounting to PHP 50,000. He will use this loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticide. He knows that through supplying his crops with complete farm inputs he can obtain a better harvest. Rex is hoping for approval of his loan.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticides use for his farming business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating root crops for sale to earn a living. With her income from her farm she was able to put up a food production business making and selling longanisa in their village. Farming is her main source of income and she finds ways to augment it.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. In the future Vivian hopes to expand her farm to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Battsetseg, 45 years old, lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been rendering transportation services to local people for more than ten years. Her daughter currently studies at university, while her son goes to high school. She is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to buy building materials such as cement, bricks, planks and fiberglass to build a barn next to her house. The borrower is very hardworking individual who used her previous loans for there purpose each time and repaid all installments without any delay. Two years ago, her husband left his family and since that time, she is doing all the work she can to make sure her children get adequate education for their future.

loans.use: to build a barn next to her house

loans.name: Analen

texts.en:
Analen is 32 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Analen works very hard to provide for them.

Analen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Analen has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Analen would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 41 years old. She is married and has nine children. To sustain her family's needs she raise hogs and sells them them when grown. She wants to improve the hog's nutrition. but she has insufficient funds and that is why she is now asking for additional capital of P 3,000 to buy hog feed for sustainability. She hopes this loan will be given to her as so she can sell her hogs at higher cost someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed for sustainability

loans.name: Isrrael Benjamin

texts.es:
Isrrael tiene 52 años de edad, solo estudió primer grado de nivel académico, está casado y su esposa se dedica al trabajo doméstico, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia en la escuela y los demás le ayudan en el trabajo agrícola, por lo tanto su esposa e hijos dependen de Isrrael.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseñó su padre con la intención de que aprendiera el oficio para que en un futuro le sirviera de mucho, para llegar al lugar donde trabaja debe hacer un recorrido de 10 minutos a pie, siendo la agricultura su única actividad productiva y trabaja de 6 de la mañana a 12 del mediodía. 


El crédito lo necesita para comprar 4 sacos de abono, esto le servirá porque la milpa ya va a comenzar ha echar elotes entonces debe abonar para que el cultivo sea bueno.


Sus sueños son seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén del hogar.
texts.en:
Isrrael is 52 years old and only studied up to Grade 1. He is married and has 6 children. Only one of them is studying in school, the others help him with his agricultural work. His wife does the domestic work. So his wife and children are dependent on him. He has worked in agriculture since he was 15 years old. His father taught him with the intention that he learn this work as in the future it would be of great use to him. It is a 10 minutes walk to get to where he works and he works from 6 in the morning until 12 noon. This is his only productive activity.

He needs the loan to buy 4 bags of fertilizer. This will be useful to him as the corn is just starting to develop cobs and it is a good time to fertilize the soil. His dream is to continue to cultivate the land as this is how he supports his household.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clean and efficient liquefied petroleum gas cooking energy.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en: Eloisa has a transportation services business and has been operating this for more than six years to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for motor accessories. It helps a lot to sustain their living aside from her business. To purchase of tires & spare parts, she borrowed another loan from GDMPC micro credit. In the future she wants to improve the general living situation of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase tires & spare parts

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 20-year-old single man from a small village near Nablus city. This village is very famous for its agricultural crops. Wisam works on the family land, where he plants seasonal crops. He uses greenhouses to ensure he gets a good quality.

Wisam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy fertilizers for his agricultural land. This will help him improve the land conditions. 

Wisam appears in the photo on his land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his agricultural land.

loans.name: Rodelrick

texts.en:
Rodelrick is operating a farm to earn a living and has been doing this for more than seven years in order to provide for the needs of his family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used for farming. 

Finding ways to augment their living, he wants to improve his farm. With this, he took a new loan recently in order to purchase fertilizers.

In the future, he wants to purchase another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es viudo y tiene 4 hijos Jusn vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Juan trabaja como chofer y quiere un crédito para comprar llantas para su vehiculo Jusn es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y las ruedas de su vehiculo se encuentran muy gastadas lo cual le puede llevar a un accidente, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Juan is a widower and has four children. He lives in a brick and cement house that he owns in La Paz.

Juan works as a chauffeur and needs a loan so that he can buy tires for his vehicle. He is the only one earning income for his household and the wheels on his vehicle are completely worn out, which could lead to an accident. For this reason, he is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, 47 years of age, is married to a driver and blessed with six children. Evelyn has been in the tailoring business in their village for almost 10 years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income is usually spent on the school allowances for their children. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase needles, pins, sewing threads, and fabric. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase needles, pins, sewing threads, and fabric

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old and married with three children.  

Norma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Norma has been in this business for six years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bukhtumur

texts.en: Mr. Bukhtumur, 72 years old, lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandsons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife have retired from work and get a state pension. Their son is a driver and renders taxi service to the local people. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to install an electric heater under the floor. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to install an electric heater under the floor

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en: Cinderella is 38 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one school-age child. To earn a living, Cinderella has been engaged in the snack vending business for two years already and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She is also supported by her husband who is a farmer.  She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of snacks to sell. Cinderella has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, Cinderella hopes to expand her snack vending business.

loans.use: To purchase additional snacks to sell

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en: Ruel is studying in a university in order to help his parents in the future. One of his ambitions is to have a better career to earn a better income that would help him sustain a living. He borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester. He is thankful to GDMPC for the chance to be a partner in his journey.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren is a 42-year-old divorcee who lives with her son in her own private fenced house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a woman who works hard for her family. Her son graduated from the secondary school this year. Mrs. Purevsuren earns a living by making winter clothes for babies and casual clothes for men and women, which she sells in a local outdoor market. She started her business in 2002 and  Mrs. Purevsuren's business is the main source of her family's income. She is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT (Mongolian tugrigs) to buy raw materials for making clothing and to increase her output and business earnings. Her goal for the future is to own a clothes shop in downtown Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making clothing.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 57 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children, six of whom are now adults and one is still school age. Leonila is engaged in managing a car radiator repair shop together with her husband. He has been the repairman for 15 years already and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional bronze rods, flux, copper and other accessories and materials for their radiator repair shop business. Leonila has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Leonila hopes to expand their radiator repair shop business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bronze rods, flux, copper and other accessories and materials

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn is 24 years old and single. She lives in a rural community with her beloved parents. Due to lack of job opportunities, she put-up a small eatery beside the public highway to generate income. She dreams that someday she will become successful and financially stable. To achieve her goal, she aimed to improve and strengthen her business to generate a higher income. Due to capital insufficiency, Juvelyn wants to access a loan of PHP 12,000.00 to buy fresh vegetables, pork, chicken, fish, and seasonings to be cooked and additional grocery items to  sell in her eatery. She hopes that she will be granted her loan request to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables, pork, chicken, fish, and seasonings to be cooked and additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Yeyen

texts.en:
Yeyen raises pigs for a living and has been doing this for ten years. Her previous loan used for feeding supplies was successfully repaid.  Now she earns a better income. 

To buy additional piglets to raise, she applied for a new loan recently. Yeyen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en: Mr. Odsuren, 38 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling broken automobiles, after repairing them, to local people since 2004. Currently his son is studying strategy at university. His wife sells clothes at the trade center. He is requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After the renovation his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Narannyam

texts.en: Mr. Narannyam is 30 years old and lives with his mother and sister in a traditional  Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling clothes to local people for more than two years. He is requesting a loan of 3500000 MNT to buy clothes in large quantity so he can continue to run his business without worrying about inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy clothes in large quantity

loans.name: Bara'

texts.en:
Bara' is a 21-year-old single man from a small village near Tulkarm city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Bara' works on the family land where he plants seasonal crops. He uses greenhouses to insure he gets a good quality crop.
Bara' took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy plastic covers for the greenhouses.  This will help him improve the land and prepare it for the new crops.
Bara' appears in the photo in his land

loans.use: to buy plastic covers for the greenhouses.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie landed at the right place for her capital needs when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she availed of another loan for the next crop season. The loan is for land and seed bed preparation.  Marjorie perseveres and always believes she can reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seed bed preparation

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan, 29 years old, lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines with her husband and children. Her husband earns minimum wage. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through retail, selling basic commodities.  She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2012. She became a Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she is applying for 25,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en: Rodelyn is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of Php 14,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs for her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: for house renovation

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en: Diosa has been working on their own farm for many years with her husband to make a living. With her generated income from farm produce, she was able to provide and sustain their living. Planning to improve the farm, she took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer. Diosa hopes to increase her harvest so as to take care of her family’s daily needs and to purchase additional farmland as well.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Marites is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 52 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 sons now at their college and high school years. 
For their means of living, Edwina has managed a sand and gravel distribution business for 2 years and a hollow block processing business. She earns approximately PHP 15,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase additional sacks of cement, sand and gravel for her new line of business, which is hollow block processing.
Edwina has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future Edwina hopes to expand her sand and gravel distribution and hollow block processing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of cement, sand and gravel

loans.name: Arjelin

texts.en: Arjelin, a 36-year-old mother of two, has been raising pigs for 15 years to make a living. She does all these things with her husband in order to augment their living situation. To purchase additional piglets to raise, she borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) recently. She has joined GDMPC because she wants to gain access to microfinance services. In the future, Arjelin wants to expand her piggery in order to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer is married with four children and operates a transportation business, while his wife raises pigs for a living. For four years in running a transportation business, Elmer was happy to say that this helped his family a lot. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy tires and to cover the costs for motor repair. In the future he wants to have a better living for his family.

loans.use: to buy tires and to cover the costs for motor repair

loans.name: Tone

texts.en: Tone bought 30 goats with the previous loan and the livestock activity has been going well since then. However, the last few months she hasn't been feeling well and health specialists have suggested surgery asap. This is the reason why she is requesting your help again. With the money she had put aside she paid the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to cover medical expenses.

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like pants, blouses, and school uniforms.

Maricor has been in this business for two years. Maricor earns more income from a general store.

Maricor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses, and school uniforms.

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en: Liezel is a businesswoman from Plaridel. She is 38 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items.
