She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Mylen has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Takeshi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TAKESHI” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Norma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de perfumes, venta de salchipapa, tejido de tapetes, costura de vestidos, venta de comida, costura de pantalones, tienda de barrio, taller de carpintería, venta de ropa americana, venta de cerveza, venta de material de limpieza.
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Norma es integrante, ella indica que  hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura de vestidos de novias; da a conocer que la elaboración de los vestidos los aprendió en una institución de formación técnica, posteriormente decide implementarlo como fuente de generación económica, ya que el mismo se comercializa ampliamente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, los ahorros, el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “TAKESHI” communal bank will begin its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Santiago II Center. It is made up of twelve members and is led by a board of directors of which Norma is the president. The businesses that the members have are varied. Among them are: selling perfume, selling  salchipapa, weaving tablecloths, sewing dresses, selling food, sewing pants, a neighborhood store, a carpentry shop, selling American clothes, selling beer, and selling cleaning supplies.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small businesswomen, including Norma. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business sewing wedding dresses. She says that she learned to make the dresses at a trade school. Later, she decided to use the skill as a source of income, because they sell well. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying fabric wholesale. She will acquire the fabric from wholesalers in the city of  La Paz and after making the dresses, she will sell them in her sales space. this work allows her to generate resources for her family, since she is married and has four children.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the trainings, the savings and the health programs offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Sheena

texts.en: Sheena is 23 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle. Sheena has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 46 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc. Evangeline has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Vergilia

texts.en: Vergilia is 43 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Vergilia has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Winifreda

texts.en:
Winifreda is from Poblacio Alto, Sergio Osmena, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 65 years of age and married. In 2012 Winifreda joined Paglaum MPC and appreciates the programs and services of said co-op. She became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She and her husband manage a small machine shop in her hometown. With their business they face many challenges. Their business is not sufficient for their daily needs. From her desire to help the family, Winifreda has become engaged in selling fish in different barangays in the municipality of Sergio Osmena, Zamboanga del Norte, with the help of her children.  This other source of income has existed for almost 2 years now. 

Winifreda has requested financial assistance from Paglaum MPC in the amount of PHP 50,000.00 to purchase stock of pancit (noodles) as another source of income. She and her family welcome the new idea that while peddling fish they might also sell pancit to different sari-sari stores too. Through this new project, she hopes to increase her income and provide for the daily needs of her family. She is happy she can support the education of her grandchildren, which is her main priority, even with the hardship she faces.

loans.use: to purchase stock of pancit (noodles) to sell.

location.town: Poblacion Alto, Sergio Osmena, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, including canned goods, eggs, milks and soap. Emma has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years, and she also earns extra income from a motorcycle transport business, from selling dry goods, and from selling feed. Emma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, including canned goods, eggs, milk and soap.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en: Lia, who is a 49-year-old married woman, lives in village Chkhari. She has a husband and a daughter who is temporarily unemployed like her mother. Lia's husband is a private bodyguard who monthly generates 700 GEL. Lia is involved in agricultural activity. In particular she takes care of a cow and cultivates a vineyard. She sells cheese and grapes seasonally. Her income is insignificant, and Lia has a great desire somehow to expand her salary. With the requested money she plans to build a mushroom greenhouse. Lia will sell mushrooms to local retailers for a good price and will get good profit. With this additional income, she will be able to overcome her financial difficulties and save some money as well. Lia and her family will be grateful for the help and will highly appreciate it. She awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: To build a mushroom greenhouse

loans.name: Solima

texts.en: Solima is 53 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Solima has a food stall in the Philippines. She applied for a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more spices and fish to sell. Solima has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Solima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and fish to sell.

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es:
José de 58 años de edad,  es un agricultor de la zona, logro estudiar hasta 9° grado en la escuela de su cantón y no logro seguir estudiando,  ya que su padre falleció cuando él apenas tenía quince años entonces dejo sus estudios y tomar las riendas de su familia parar sacarlas adelante.

Está casado y es padre de dos hijos; un varón que vive en el extranjero y una hembra que está estudiando en la universidad.

En esta zona rural del cantón la actividad productiva es el cultivo del maíz y frijol y José desde hace más de 30 años se ha dedicado a esta actividad,  cultiva lo que son maíz y frijol,  cultiva tres hectáreas  de terreno también se dedica a otra actividad la cual es la cría de ganado que consiste en comprar bovinos pequeños y repastarlos durante aproximadamente 8 meses,  esta actividad fue enseñada por su yerno  quien solo se dedica a esta activad y le ha generado muchas ganancias. 

El crédito será invertido para comprar tres bovinos y los pastara en unos terrenos rústicos que tiene como a un kilómetro de su casa. Esto mejorara su calidad de vida,  ya que tendrá activos corrientes los cuales venderá cuando tengan un buen margen de ganancia.

Él tiene planeado comprar tres bovinos para pastarlos y venderlos, cuando ya este próximo a vencer su crédito ya que tendrá un buen margen de ganancia y así podrá pagar su crédito y con las ganancias que le quede podrá trabajar poco con su propio capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
José, 58 years old, is a local farmer. He studied until the ninth grade in a local school, but couldn't continue studying as his father died when he was barely 15, and he had to stop his studies and take the reins of his family.

He is married and father to two children: one boy who lives abroad and a girl who is studying at university.

In this rural area of the province the principal productive activity is growing corn and beans, and José has worked in this area for more than 30 years. He grows corn and beans in three hectares of land. He also works in another activity - rearing cattle - which consists of buying small cattle and putting them out to pasture for around 8 months. He was taught this activity by his son-in-law, who works solely in this trade and has generated good income from this.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of three cattle, which he will put out to pasture in some lands which he has around one kilometer from his house. This will improve his quality of life, as he will have current assets which he will sell when he has a good profit margin.

He plans to buy three cattle to put out to pasture and sell when he is close to having to pay back his loan, as he will have a good profit margin and so will be able to pay off the loan, and with the earnings he is left with he will be able to work a little with his own working capital.

loans.use: to buy three cattle and put them out to pasture in lands that he has one kilometer from his house.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz is 53 years old and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, including shampoo and groceries. Paz has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from selling vegetables. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, including shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 59 years old, a widow with three children. Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income by tailoring. Lilia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en: Naima, 40 years old, is a single Ugandan lady with two children, only of whom attends school. She operates a retail shop, coupled with selling food, which provides supplementary income. For seven years, she has been in business, and the motivating factor has been to develop herself and increase her income. She needs a loan to buy land. Defaulters have continued to be a big menace to her business, together with constant price fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Ramazan

texts.en: Ramazan is a father of six children ranging in age from thirteen to twenty-four years old; he is in his mid-fifties and lives in rural south-central Albania.  Currently he’s got animals including one cow, ten sheep, one horse, and chickens; orchards including plums, apples, and pears; and he also plants seasonal veggies, grains and other crops. Ramazan has an established clientele to whom he sells his dairy and other fresh products. He is requesting this loan to add one more cow to the existing herd; according to him, he’s got expenses since all of his children go to school. This will be his first loan and the amount he is seeking from you is 150,000 Albanian Lek (ALL).

loans.use: to add one more dairy cow to the existing herd

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 39 años es casado y padre de 5 niños.
La pastelería es La actividad que viene realizando toda su vida, rolando terminó sus estudios secundarios y accedió a un curso de pastelería , poco a poco se fue especializando y participando en otros cursos, adquirió un préstamo otorgado por sus padres con el cual compró un horno, se casó y junto a su esposa abrieron un negocio; una pastelería: ¨al principio no había  mucha clientela teníamos que acércanos a los colegios e universidades y dejarles a los kioscos y cafeterías nuestras masitas y pasteles.¨
A medida que su pastelería era más conocida su familia crecía, sus hijos tienen muchas ganas de aprender su oficio; ¨mis niños quieren hornear pero no los dejo, me dá miedo pues el horno calienta mucho y se pueden quemar…¨.
Rolando comienza su labor en la madrugada, enciende el horno a las 4 am porque la pastelería debe estar lista para las 8am., durante el día su esposa se encarga de la venta mientras que él descansa. Los niños estudian en una escuela pública cercana y por las tardes colaboran a su mamá. Rolando se esfuerza al máximo para darles bienestar a sus hijos y esposa, por eso encuentra la necesidad de ampliar su negocio y crear una panadería.
Es por ese motivo que rolando solicita un préstamo para tener una pastelería más grande y crear una panadería.
texts.en:
Rolando is 39 years old, married, and father of 5 children.

The pastry shop is the job that he has been doing his whole life. Rolando finished his secondary education and entered a pastry course.  Little by little, he began to specialize and take other courses. He got a loan granted by his parents with which he purchased an oven. He married and, with his wife, opened a business - a pastry shop. "At first there weren't many customers and we had to go to the secondary schools and universities and leave our pastries and cakes in the food stalls and cafeterias."

As his pastry shop became more known, his family grew. His children really want to learn the job,"My children want to bake but I don't let them, I'm scared because the oven gets very hot and they could get burned...".

Rolando begins his work in the early morning; he turns on his oven at 4am because the pastries should be ready at 8am. During the day, his wife takes care of sales while he rests. The children study at a nearby public school and in the afternoon they work with their mom. Rolando puts forth his best effort for the well-being of his children and wife; for this reason, he finds he needs to expand his business and make a bakery (bread shop). 

For this goal, Rolando asks for a loan to have a larger pastry shop and open a bakery.

loans.use: to have a larger pastry shop and open a bakery.

loans.name: Diana Geraldine

texts.es:
Diana es una joven emprendedora, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive en el Distrito de San Vicente junto a su familia.
Desde hace 1 año trabaja en el Área de Video-vigilancia de una empresa, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y honesta y sobre todo porque tiene muchos deseos de superación y quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Diana está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para inaugurar un pequeño negocio de venta de jugos y así obtener un ingreso adicional que podrá utilizarlo más adelante para cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener una cadena de juguería"
texts.en:
Diana is an enterprising young woman. She is 20 years old, single and lives in the district of San Vincente with her family.

For the past year, she has worked in the area of video surveillance in a business, an it is going very well since she is a very responsible, hard-working and honest person and, above all, because she has a strong desire to improve herself and she wants to improve her family's quality of life. 

Diana is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support that they have offered her, she will be able to purchase the merchandise to open a small business selling juice, and also to have additional income that she will be able to use in the future to accomplish her greatest dream: to have a chain of juice shops.

loans.use: to open a business selling juices.

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socios exitosos y es coordinado por la señora Yokasta de 20 años de edad y soltera, es propietaria de un taller de zapatería, la socia solicita el crédito para invertir en materia prima como es cuero sintético, pega amarilla, pega blanca, cajuelas, suelas, hebillas, etc. Otros dde los socios es el señor Humberto de 33 años de edad comerciante de ropa y calzado en su comundad, y la señora Carla de 31 años de edad quien elabora y vende miel mesada en las calles de su comunidad.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is made up of three successful members and is coordinated by Yokasta, 20 years old and single, who is the owner of a shoe repair shop.  She asks for a loan to invest in raw materials such as synthetic leather, yellow adhesive, white adhesive, PVC resin, soles, buckles, etc.

The other members are Humberto, 33, who sells clothing and footwear in his community and Carla, 31, who makes and sells “miel me sabe” (a Nicaraguan dessert made of milk and unrefined cane sugar) on the streets of her community.

loans.use: to purchase raw material, such as synthetic leather, yellow adhesive, white adhesive, PVC resin, soles, buckles, etc.

loans.name: Severina

texts.es:
Severina tiene 44 años de edad es casada y con un hijo de 6 años.
Su marido trabaja como chofer de transporte público ya hace varios años.
Severina se encarga de su hijo, compra su ropa, lo asea y se encarga de sus estudios; ¨mi hijito es niño, tiene 6 años y me vé como a su heroe¨, el niño asiste a clases en una escuela pública cercana, se ocupa de estudiar y también ayuda en la atención de clientes.
Severina es cocinera; durante la mañana se encarga de preparar el menú del almuerzo diario, hace las compras muy temprano por la mañana para tener todo listo a medio día, por la tarde junto a su hijo reciben y transportan varios quilos de pollo; lo lavan, sazonan y terminando la tarde se dedican a la venta de pollo frito, esta comida es muy apreciada por sus clientes quienes cada noche asisten a su local a saborearlo.
Esta actividad sostiene a la familia, paga los estudios la alimentación y la ropa de su hijo, es por eso que no pueden dejar ni un día de trabajar; ¨Día que no trabajamos es día que no comemos¨ comenta Severina.
Hace unos días ¨la freidora¨ (su herramienta de trabajo) se malogró y tuvieron muchas dificultades con sus clientes y por tanto económicas también.
Es por este motivo que Severina solicita un préstamo para reparar su freidora y la compra de mayor cantidad de pollo para su local.
texts.en:
Severina is 44 years old, is married, and has a 6 year old son. 

Her husband has worked as a public transport driver for some years now.

Severina is responsible for her son, buys his clothing, washes it, and is in charge of his schooling: 'my little boy is a child, he is 6 years old, and sees me as his hero,'. He attends classes at a nearby public school, busies himself with studying and also helps with attending to customers. 

Severina is a cook; during the morning she is responsible for preparing the daily lunch menu, doing the shopping very early in the morning to have everything ready for mid day. In the afternoon, together with her son, they receive and transport many kilos of chicken; they wash it, season it and finish the afternoon selling fried chicken. This food is very appreciated by her customers, who every night come to her store to enjoy it. 

This work sustains the family, pays for school, food, and clothes for their son, and this is why they can't let even one day go by without working; 'A day that we don't work is a day that we don't eat,' comments Severina.

A few days ago the deep fryer (their working tool) broke down, and they had many issues with their customers, and therefore economic problems too. It is for this reason that Severina asks for a loan to repair her deep fryer and to buy a higher quantity of chicken for her store.

loans.use: to repair her deep fryer and to buy higher quantities of chicken for her store.

loans.name: Lizeth Sandra

texts.es:
Lizeth es una joven estudiante de 18 años de edad soltera y sin hijos.
Tiene 4 hermanos de toda edad, algunos en colegio otros ya casados. Desde muy niña aprendió a trabajar porque las necesidades propias y de su hogar eran muchas y los padres no abastecían por completo.
A su corta edad y con la ayuda de sus padres montó una librería, la cual atiende todos los días.
Lizeth piensa mucho en su familia y no le gustaría que sus descendientes pasen por todas las dificultades que ella vivió, es por eso que se dedica exclusivamente a sus estudios actividad que comparte con su librería.
Ella paga su colegiatura con su librería, de día se dedica a atender su negocio, por las noches pasa clases en la universidad, sueña con tener su propia farmacia ya conoce el negocio y está segura que será todo un éxito.
Es por este motivo que Lizeth solicita un préstamo para pagar sus mensualidades de la colegiatura por adelantado.
texts.en: Lizeth is a young student aged 18. She is single and has no children, but four brothers and sisters of all ages. Some of them go to school, others are already married. She started to work at a very young age because her parents' incomes were not enough to support the whole family. With the help of her parents, she set up a bookshop, at which she works every day. Lizeth thinks a lot about her family and does not want her future children to suffer the same hardship she had to endure, which is why she is very dedicated to her studies. The bookshop helps her pay for university fees. She works there during the day and then goes to evening classes at university. Her dream is to set up a pharmacy, a business she learned a lot about and at which she is sure to succeed. This is why Lizeth asks for a loan to pay her university monthly payments in advance.

loans.use: to pay her university fees in advance.

loans.name: Thania Libertad

texts.es: Thania tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Thania trabajo en una institución cercana a sus localidad lo cual le permite llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y junto a su esposo mantienen la economía  de su familia. Thania ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto para lo cual necesita materiales como ladrillo, hierro, cemento, arena, etc.
texts.en:
Thania is 32 years old and lives in her own house together with her partner and their 5 year old child.

Thania works in a nearby institution which allows her to bring daily sustenance to her home. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her family, and together with her husband they maintain the family's finances.

Thania has made the decision to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a room for which she will need materials like brick, iron, cement, sand, etc.

loans.use: to buy: bricks, iron, cement, sand, etc. to construct a room.

loans.name: Tunagurane Group

texts.fr:
Générose   fait partie du groupe Tunagurane  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 58  ans et est mariée à Daniel, un cuisinier. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants  âgés de 19 à 36 ans dont 4  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  tomates, des oignons,... depuis  3 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son  capital et acheté une grande quantité de tomate et d’oignons, à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, elle  voudrait   voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Générose, age 58, is a member of the group Tunagurane and she lives in Bujumbura. She is married to a cook named Daniel, and they have seven children ages 19 to 36 years old, four of whom go to school. 

Générose has been selling tomatoes, onions, etc. for 3 years. This is her first loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use the funds to strengthen her working capital. She will stock up on tomatoes and onions to bolster her sales and revenue.

In the coming years, she would like to see her children pursue their education.

loans.use: to stock up on tomatoes and onions to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza owns and manages a small retail store within the local community. She is 22 years old, married and blessed with one child. She and her husband are aimed to improve their status of living. With this regard, Riza wants to improve more of her business in order to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like a loan of PHP45,000.00 to buy rice, beverages, soft drinks, snack foods, laundry soaps, seasonings and canned goods to sell. Having patience and strong determination, Riza believes that she will achieve her goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, beverages, soft drinks, snack foods, laundry soaps, seasonings and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Amee Marie

texts.en: Amee Marie is 23 years old. She is single and has been in the business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bridal gowns to sell. She plans to use the profits for reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more bridal gowns to sell

loans.name: Jiza

texts.en:
Jiza is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Jiza is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: La Ceibita Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias exitosas y lo coordina la señora María Gabriela de 34 años de edad y casada, quien es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 5 años, la socia solicita el crédito para invertir en productos de mayor demanda por parte de la población, como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, plátano verde, plátano maduro, sopas maggui, pan, variedad de pastillas como es panadol, ranitidina, tabcin, alka zeltzer, etc, la socia con los créditos anteriores ha logrado la compra de accesorios de uso personal, además que ha ampliado el inventario porque ahora ofrece productos que antes no vendía por falta de capital de dinero. Otra de las socias es la señora Aura de 41 años de edad dedicada a la compra-venta de cosechas en el mercado de la municipalidad y tiene 10 años de experiencia en este negocio, y la señora Trinidad de 58 años comerciante de futas y verduras, la socia se ha dedicado en este negocio por más de 15 años.
texts.en:
This loan group has three successful members, including 34-year-old María Gabriela as its coordinator. María is married and has had a grocery store for five years. She is applying for this loan in order to invest in products that are popular with the locals. These goods include rice, beans, oil, plantains, bananas, Maggui soup, bread, and a variety of over-the-counter medicines, including Panadol, Ranitidina, Tabcin, and Alka Zeltzer. María used her previous loan to buy personal items, and to increase her stock. She now sells goods that she did not previously sell due to a lack of capital.

One other member of the group is Aura, who is 41 years old. She makes a living buying and selling harvests at the local markets; Aura has ten years experience with this business. The group's final member is 58-year-old Trinidad, a businesswoman selling fruits and vegetables; she has had this business for over 15 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and beans, and oil, plantains, bananas, Maggui soup, bread, and a variety of over-the-counter medicines, including Rantidina, Tacin, Alka Zeltzer and Panadol.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business selling clothing.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nena works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing.  Nena is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Berchmans  fait partie du groupe Confiance  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 32  ans et est marié à Pascasie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de 9 à 12 ans, tous  étudient.

Il fait le commerce  de la bière industrielle et de la limonade dans son bistrot depuis  12 ans. 

Il est son dixième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son  capital et  acheter par conséquent  30 caisses de bière industrielle et 5 caisses de limonade, à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, il  voudrait   construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Berchmans, age 32, is a member of the group Confiance and he lives in Bujumbura. He is married to a merchant named Pascasie, and they have two children ages 9 and 12 years old who both attend school.  

Berchmans runs a bistro where he has been selling industrial beer and lemonade for 12 years. This is his 10th loan cycle with Turame, and he plans to use the funds to strengthen his working capital. He will purchase 30 cases of industrial beer and 5 cases of lemonade to bolster his sales and revenue.

In the coming years, he would like to build a house and see his children pursue their education.

loans.use: to purchase 30 cases of industrial beer and 5 cases of lemonade to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pesticides to help his red onions, lima beans and potatoes grow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married Ugandan woman with five children. She runs a pharmacy business and earns a salary. She joined the business world in 2008 so as to develop and sustain her family. She needs a loan to buy pharmacy drugs to sell. Her dream is to educate her children though challenged by inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy pharmacy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Amigas De 14 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS DE 14 DE ABRIL” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa de bebe y pantalones, venta de empanadas, costura de pantalones, tienda de barrio, venta de salteñas, ayudante de cocina, venta de batidos, ayudante de mecánica.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que  hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de ropa; da a conocer que la venta de este producto lo inicio por iniciativa de su hermana quien le aconsejo a que se compre un puesto de venta de las ferias mas visitadas de la ciudad de El Alto. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no se encuentra una señora porque se encontraba en consultorio médico.
texts.en:
The communal bank “AMIGAS DE 14 DE ABRIL” will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman), as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II. It is comprised of eight members, and is directed by a directive table where the woman Lourdes is President. 

The businesses that the members of the communal association carry forward are varied but between them they include: sale of baby clothing and pants, sale of empanadas, clothing sewing, neighbourhood stores, sale of salteñas (Bolivian meat pies), kitchen helper, sale of smoothies, and mechanical assistant. 

The loan that they will take will benefit small microbusinesses where Lourdes is a constituent. She indicates that a year ago she joined Pro Mujer, entering because of an invitation by a woman who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling clothing; she discloses that she started selling this product upon the initiative of her sister, who advised her that she buy a stall in one of the most visited markets in the city of El Alto. 
 
The loan she now will take is to increase capital (to buy wholesale clothing) which she will acquire from wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz, and then subsequently will sell in her retail space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has a son. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training offered by the institution. 

In the photo one woman is missing because she was in the doctor's office.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Jose Marcelo

texts.es:
José tiene 21 años de edad es soltero y sin hijos, terminó sus estudios secundarios en una escuela nocturna porque de día trabaja, vive con sus padres y aporta dinero para su hogar; ¨mis padres me enseñaron  a trabajar desde muy pequeño, ahora soy independiente y me dá mucho gusto aportar con dinero a mi hogar y el de mis padres¨. Ahora el estudia contabilidad y trabaja en la venta de dvds, con esa labor paga sus estudios y aporta dinero al hogar; ¨con mi trabajo pago mis gastos estudiantiles pero a la vez me quita ucho tiempo y a veces falto a clases...¨.
el quisier terminar rápido su carrera y ejercerla pero el tiempo que tiene lo dificulta un poco, necesita apoyo economico para terminar de pagar sus estudios y también para ayudarse a manejar su tiempo en las ventas.
es por ese motivo que José solicita un préstamo para terminar de pagar las mensualidades de la universidad y para la compra de libros.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old, single and has no children. He finished high school at night school as he worked during the day. José lives with his parents and provides an income for his household. He says, "My parents taught me to work from a young age, and now I am independent. I am very pleased to bring money back to my and my parents' household". 

José is now studying accounting, while working selling DVDs. This work allows him to pay for his studies and bring home an income. "With my work I pay for the costs of my studies but, at the same, it takes up a lot of time and sometimes I miss classes," says José.

José wants to finish his degree quickly, and start practising his profession. However, this is difficult. José needs financial support in order to finish paying for his studies and also to help manage his time working in sales.

Because of this, José is applying for a loan in order to pay university fees and buy books.

loans.use: to pay university fees and buy books.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Benedicta is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Benedicta has been farming rice  for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is twenty nine years old. He does cattle fattening. He has a taxi for transport business as an additional income. He hopes to educate his children through university level. Kennedy is a hardworking man however challenged by inadequate capital and the poor roads causing constant mechanical break downs. He wants a loan to buy another car for his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy another car for his taxi business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, age 35 years old, is a married Ugandan female with five children. She does cattle fattening as well as selling clothes to add to her income. She has been in business for two years now, and her dream is to get out of poverty. She is challenged by high license fees. Ruth needs a loan to buy cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
La socia María  tiene 35 años tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cultiva lo que es café entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
María belongs to the "KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI" communal bank which is located in the district of Echarate, La Convención Province, Cusco.Department.

María is 35 years old, has one child and is in a common-law relationship. She combines her daily activities with farming. The member has been doing this for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day.

She grows coffee amongst other things that her clients want. She wants to continue working in this manner so that she can continue to help support her family. This loan is part of a line of loans called Credi Yapa from Asociación Arariwa. These loans are awarded to borrowers that have a good credit history. María is requesting the loan to buy manure and seeds amongst others. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds amongst others.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
El socio tiene 23 años y es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como pollos, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio a la vez trabaja en una empresa publica,el socio  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos y alimento para sus animales.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is part of the "Kimoyganakera Maganiroigi" commnal bank in the Echarate district of the La Convención province in Cusco department, Peru.

Juan is 23 years old, single and works raising young animals such as chickens. Juan has had this business for quite some time, and it is going well because of his determination at work every day. Juan also works for a public enterprise. He wants to continue working in order to continue supporting his family.

Juan is applying for this loan in order to buy chickens and animal feed.

Juan feels grateful for this loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed for his animals.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad y vive en Sunampe junto a su familia.
Tiene un hijo quien es su mayor inspiración en la vida y una esposa quien día a día lo alienta para salir adelante. Desde hace 1 años trabaja como Operario en una bodega, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable y porque cumple siempre con las labores que se le asignan.
Jose está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han  brindado él podrá comprar un televisor para su casa, de esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida y su familia podrá disfrutar de momentos agradables en su hogar.
texts.en: Jose is a young entrepreneur who lives with his family in Sunampe. He has a son who is the biggest inspiration in his life and a wife who feeds the child each day to make him grow. For the past year Jose has been working in a store and things are going well for him as he is very hard-working, responsible and always fulfills the tasks that are assigned to him. Jose is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they offer he can buy a TV set for his house. In this way he can improve the quality of living for his family so they can enjoy some entertainment in their home.

loans.use: to buy a TV.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
Madame Alassane est une dame de la soixantaine, qui s’active dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC, et voyant que son fond de commerce était instable, il sollicite un crédit de 50 000F pour pouvoir améliorer son activité. Elle a une table où elle vend des produits divers alimentaires, des fruits de la période. 
Madame Alassane est mariée et mère de famille. Elle peut avoir une recette journalière de mille cinq cent francs, les 500f sont mis de coté comme épargne et les 1 000 f, réinvesti dans l’activité pour l’achat de marchandises. Elle appuie dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne du foyer.
Elle aimerait agrandir son activité et diversifier les produits et services.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alassane is a lady in her 60s who is married with children. She has been working in small trade for many years. She has a booth where she sells various food products and seasonal fruit. 

She did not previously need financial assistance from IMCEC but with her capital being somewhat less stable, she is now seeking a loan of 50,000F to bolster her business. She could earn up to 1,500F per day, placing 500F in her savings and using the remainder to replenish her stock of merchandise. 

She helps with the management of her household’s day-to-day expenses. 

In the coming years, she would like to expand and diversify her commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy food products and seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Marta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
La socia Blanca Marta  tiene 64 años tiene 08 hijos y es divorciada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Blanca Marta is part of the "Kimoyganakera Maganiroigi" commnal bank in the Echarate district of the La Convención province in Cusco department, Peru.

Blanca is 64 years old. She is divorced and has eight children. Blanca has been working in farming for quite some time, and her business is going well thanks to her determination every day. As well as her farming work, Blanca also has a grocery store. Blanca wants to continue working in order to support her family. This loan is part of a series of loans called "Credi Yapa" with "Asosiación Arariwa". This series of loan is granted to borrowers with a good credit rating.

Blanca is applying for a loan in order to buy manure, seeds and more.

Blanca feels grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, purlins, sand, cement and sand in order to build a hall in his house.

loans.name: Evelyn Estebana

texts.es: Evelyn tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de un año de edad. Evelyn  se dedica a la venta de productos nutricionales desde hace mucho tiempo. La venta la hace de forma ambulante y gracias a su carisma ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Evelyn solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, hierro, teja, etc. para construir el techo de la vivienda.
texts.en: Evelyn is 24 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and one-year-old daughter. Evelyn has been making a living selling nutritional goods for a long time. She makes her sales as a street vendor and, with great charisma, Evelyn now has a many customers who prefer Eveyln's business over others. Evelyn is applying for this loan in order to buy metal sheeting, iron bars, roof tiles and more in order to build a roof on her home.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, iron bars, roof tiles and more in order to build a roof on her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 27 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Ailyn works very hard to provide for the family.

Ailyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ailyn has restarted her clothing retail business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken out a 9,960 Philippine peso housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ailyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. She would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia La Convención y departamento Cusco.
La socia Maria Concepción tiene 48 años tiene 06 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio  de venta de ropa ,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Maria Concepción, belongs to the communal bank “Kimoyganakera Maganiroigi,” which is located in the district of Echarate in La Convención province in the department of Cusco.  Maria Concepción is 48 years old.  She has 6 children and is in a relationship.  She divides her time between her daily chores and her business selling clothing.  She has been working at this business for a good while and it is going well for her thanks to the efforts that she puts into her business each day.  At the same time she has a small grocery store business.  She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she will continue supporting her family.  

This loan is part of a series of loans from Asociación Arariwa called Credi Yapa.  This line of credit is offered to borrowers with good credit history.

The member is requesting the loan to purchase milk and sugar, among other things. She feels very grateful for the loan given to her and is committed to complying with her established installment payments.

loans.use: to purchase milk and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Jannet Jesica

texts.es:
Jannet es una joven estudiante universitaria, tiene 21 años de edad es soltera y sin hijos.
ella estudia administración de empresas en la universidad mayor de San Andrés, su tiempo libre lo dedica a la atención de una tienda de abarrotes de su familia.
Jannet es una estudiante muy aplicada siempre representó a su escuela en las olimpiadas de matemáticas organizadas por el gobierno;¨siempre recibí diplomas de buen estudio, y una vez llegué al final de una olimpiada de matemáticas salí en tercer lugar...¨comenta.
su familia y sus hermanos viven de los ingresos obtenidos por una tienda de abarrotes, ella es la primera de su familia en ingresar a una universidad, sus gastos ahora son mayores porque tiene que comprar libros y material de estudio, además de las fotocopias y gasta mucho en pasajes del transporte diario.
su sueño es tener un buen salario para cubrir los gastos del hogar y poder estudiar otra carrera.
es por esos motivos que Jannet solicita un préstamo para la compra de libros universitarios, computadora y gastos de transporte.
texts.en:
Jannet is a young college student.  She is 21 years old, single and does not have children.  She is studying business administration in a major university in San Andrés.  She spends her spare time taking carer of her family's grocery store.  Jannet is a very committed student and always represented her school in the math olympics.  She says that she always received awards for her academic excellence, and one time she reached the finals of the math olympics and finished in third place.  Her family and her brothers live off of the earnings they generate from their grocery store.  She is the first in her family to attend college.  Her expenses are now greater since she must purchase books, study materials, make photocopies and spend a lot of money on her daily transportation.  

Her dream is to have a better salary to cover her housing expenses and to be able to study for another degree.  For these reasons, Jannet is seeking a loan to purchase textbooks, a computer and to pay for transportation costs.

loans.use: purchase textbooks, a computer and pay for transportation costs.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 28 años de edad,  es un hombre trabajador estudio hasta el bachillerato se casó, su esposa es ama de casa, juntos son padres de dos niños hasta el momento sola una asiste a la escuela.
Él es albañil pero decidió dedicarse al trabajo de  estructuras metálicas,  ya que posee conocimientos y tiene posibilidades  para poner en marcha este negocio y así poder tener otra actividad económica que le genere más ingresos para el hogar. 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar herramientas, como hierro, soldador, pincel, ácidos, etc. para entrarle de lleno al trabajo de las estructuras metalicas,  ya que esto le genera más ingresos que le ayudaran  a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Antonio tiene muchos planes a futuro entre ellos es preparar a sus hijos académicamente para que se ganen la vida más fácilmente, también poder tener un taller de estructuras metálicas en donde la gente acuda a comprar lo que él produce para que le genere más ingresos y que esto le permita cumplir sus ideales a futuro además de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Antonio, 28 years old, is a hardworking man who studied through high school.  He is married and his wife works at home.  Together they are the parents of two children and up until now only one of them has attended school. 

He is a bricklayer but decided to work in making metal structures as he possesses the knowledge and has the chance to start up this business and thus have another economic activity that will generate more income for his household.  He needs the loan to purchase tools like iron, a soldering iron, brushes, acids, etc., to fully get into working on metal structures, since this will generate more income for him that will help him to improve his family’s quality of life.  

Antonio has many plans for the future among them is to prepare his children academically so that they can earn a living more easily.  He also wants to be able to have a workshop for making metal structures where the people will come to buy what he produces so that it generates more income for him and that this will allow him to fulfill his goals for the future as well as improve his home.

loans.use: to buy tools like iron, a soldering iron, brushes, acids, etc., to fully get into working on metal structures.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz is a 36-year-old married man with two kids. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and he lives with his family in Bilasuvar region. He has worked in agriculture for five years, which has given him a lot of experience. This permits him to get the best harvests. He sells his harvest in the different markets that are close to his home. He already has many customers who prefer to buy from him because of the quality of his products, his good prices, and above all, his good customer service. 

Ramiz needs to invest, so he is requesting a loan of 600 AZN, which will allow him to purchase seeds and herbicides. He has good references from those who know him and he is very responsible. He says that he will be able to pay back the loan within the established time period and will also be able to promote the economic security of his household.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Elcin

texts.en: Elcin is 31 year old and a married man. His  family members have been internally displaced persons (IDP) from Füzuli City for 20 years, and are now living in the Bilasuvar region. He has been in an animal-breeding business for 6 years. Elcin prepares delicious cheese from cow's milk and sells it in the local bazaar. He learned this profession from his father. Now he needs his second loan from the Kiva organization in the amount of 1,000 AZN. With this loan, Elcin wants to repair his cows' stall. He says great thanks to the Kiva organization and all lenders for the help.

loans.use: to repair his cows' stall

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 43 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive con su conyugue en el distrito de Pomahuaca una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y frutas de estación como granadilla, naranja, chirimoya, lima entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte frontal de su vivienda, todas las mañanas arma un pequeño puesto con una sombrilla para protegerse del sol, dado que es una comunidad que hace calor y por las tardes recoge su mercadería.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 43 years old and lives with his partner in their own home made of local materials, in Pomahuaca district located in Jaén province which is part of Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands, a community where people farm, and engage in commerce and livestock-raising.

He sells groceries and fruit in season such as granadillas, oranges, chirimoyas, limes and other fruit. This business is located in the front part of his home, and every morning he sets up a small stand with a sunshade to protect against the sun, since it is a community where it is hot, and in the afternoon he gathers up his merchandise.

He has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to purchase a greater quantity of products to offer to his customers and generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of products and fruit to offer to his customers

loans.name: De Sol A Sol Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socios laboriosos, y coordinado por la señora María del Socorro de 48 años de edad, soltera con un hijo a cargo, quien ha sido su motivación para superarse y así ofrecerle mejores condiciones de vida, se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva todos los días en el mercado de la municipalidad, este negocio lo inició hace siete años y ha sido su fuente de ingresos por tal razón solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como es pantalón para damas, pantalón para caballeros, camisetas, talladores, licras, shorts, tobilleras, bóxer, etc. El grupo también lo integra la señora Rosa de 24 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva en el mercado de a municipalidad con 4 años de experiencia en el negocio y señor Hugo de 28 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva de manera ambulante en la municipalidad.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three hardworking members, and it is coordinated by María del Socorro.  She is 48 years old, single, and has one son who is her motivation to succeed in order to offer him better living conditions.  She works selling new clothing every day in the town market.  She started this business seven years ago and it has been her source of income, which is why she is seeking a loan to purchase merchandise such as pants for men and women, shirts, tights, shorts, socks, boxers, etc.

The other members of the group are Rosa, 24 years old, who sells new clothing in the town market and has done so for four years, and Hugo, 28 years old, who sells new clothing throughout the city.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as women's pants, men's pants, shirts, tights, shorts, socks, boxers, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 26 years old and married with one child who is in school. Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years. 

Jenelyn requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, Jenelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Anelita is 55 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Anelita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Anelita is taking out a PHP 9,715 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Anelita has been with NWTF since 2009 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Anelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
This nice and charming woman’s name is Ruzanna and she lives with her family in Yerevan city. She is 42 years old and she is a mother of three very beautiful girls and she is even already a grandmother.

Ruzanna has no higher education, but she is a very talented and cute housewife, and in her house she has her own small business of confectionery production. Ruzanna bakes and decorates cakes for weddings, birthdays and other parties. Her taste and imagination helps her to have her own style in the cakes’ decoration, which are nice, colorful and ethereal. She has many years of experience in this field and a lot of customers who like her baked goods very much and always give her a lot of orders.
 
Ruzanna’s husband is now unemployed and their family income is only from Ruzanna’s small business. Ruzanna’s elder daughter is married and she lives with her family. Her smallest daughter is school-aged. Her second daughter is a student at the Yerevan State Economical Institute, at the Crisis Prevention Management faculty. She studies at the paid division and her parents are worried about the repayment of her tuition fees.

Ruzanna asks for this loan in order to pay her daughter’s tuition fees for the whole year, since this period for her family is a little bit of a financially problematic one and they cannot solve this problem without Kiva's support.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fees for the whole year

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María Angélica cordiales atentos tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto con su cónyuge, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio y cría de ganado caprino, vacuno y aves como gallinas, pavos, la compra lo realiza en su caserío, así como caseríos aledaños y la venta lo realiza en zonas aledañas Chiple y Km 81, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de animales menores que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María Angélica is 31 years old and lives with his partner in their own home made of local materials, in Pomahuaca district located in Jaén province which is part of Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands, a community where people farm, and engage in commerce and livestock-raising.

She raises and sells goats, cows and poultry such as chickens and turkeys. She makes her purchases in her village and in neighboring villages, and sells in the nearby areas of Chiple and Km 81. 

She has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to purchase a variety of small animals, which will allow her to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a variety of small animals, which will allow her to increase her income.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Liezel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Liezel is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her boat for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her boat

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick used the previous loan to buy beer, soda, sugar and other general merchandise to sell. He is running a bar business, rentals and retail. He faces challenges of little capital, however, he hopes to have a self-supporting business. Patrick needs a loan to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a television.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en: Dila is a 60-year-old widowed villager, and a mother of seven, with one of the child born paraplegic. She and all of her children live in the northern rural area. The loan she is requesting now will be used to buy a tractor freeze plug. Dila is left exhausted from the plowing and preparing of the agricultural land manually, and she says she now wants to replace the labor work with a more sophisticated way. Not only that, but her oldest son plans to offer services for cash to other villagers. Dila has thirteen dairy cows and she sells baby calves to the locals, and also raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. In addition, she plants some seasonal veggies and corn for her dairy cows mostly. The village where Dila resides has a lot of pastures for livestock and a loam.

loans.use: to buy a tractor freeze plug.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en: Colleta is 28 years old, and a mother of one living in Gokwe South, Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop selling sugar, flour, cooking oil and stationery for over a year. She also volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching life skills education to students. With the requested Kiva loan, Colleta will make bulk purchases of sugar, flour, cooking oil, boxes of matches, and candles. With the additional profits, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Myrna works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  Myrna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase wood, paints, and fishing net for her fishing business. Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paints, and fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 59-year-old, married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in agriculture, mainly growing bananas and Irish potatoes. He faces hardships of weather changes and high transportation costs to the market. However, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Lawrence needs a loan to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his banana plantation.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 26-year-old, married woman from Nablus city. She is a mother with three children, two sons and one daughter. Amal and her husband opened a store to sell frozen meat and vegetables. It is a good business and earns a good income. Amal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more products to sell in their store. This will increase their sales and also their income. Amal appears in the photo in her store.

loans.use: and her husband to buy more products to sell in their store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cement, sand, bricks, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Gregoria Natty

texts.es:
Gregoria es una mujer soltera de 30 años de edad, sin hijos.
Ella aprendió a cocinar a la corta edad de 14 años la necesidad de trabajo la hizo abandonar los estudios y dedicarse enteramente a la cocina, al comienzo trabajaba como ayudante después se independizo, ¨Me gusta cocinar, es una labor diaria y me siento a gusto¨, sus metas son sueños y deseos alcanzables a corto y mediano plazo; ¨Mi sueño es tener mi propio restaurante y especializarme en comida típica nacional¨.
Gregoria lleva muchos años en la cocina, sus conocimientos vienen por la experiencia lograda en restaurantes y también por recetas adquiridas de boca a boca.
Gregoria se independizó y ahora atiende exclusivamente a sus clientes, la variedad de platos se redujo debido a la falta de utensilios de cocina, para crecer en su negocio ella necesita contar con mayor cantidad de ollas, cuchillos, etc.
Es por esa necesidad de crecer en su negocio que Gregoria solicita un préstamo para la compra de instrumentos de trabajo (utensilios de cocina).
texts.en:
Gregoria is a 30-year-old single woman with no children.

She learned how to cook at the young age of 14. The need for a job forced her to quit her studies and dedicate completely to her cooking. At first, she was working as an assistant. Then she went on her own. “I like cooking. It’s a daily work and I feel comfortable doing it.”

Her goals are dreams and wishes attainable in the short and medium term. “My dream is to have my own restaurant and specialize in local cuisine.” 

Gregoria has cooked for several years. Her knowledge comes from the experience she has had working in restaurants, and from recipes that different people have shared with her. 

Gregoria now works on her own account, and she serves exclusively to her customers. The variety of her dishes has been reduced due to the lack of cooking utensils. To make her business grow, she needs to have more pots, knifes, etc. 

That is why she is requesting a loan to buy cooking utensils.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 63 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo  quien ya es mayor de edad y le colabora con la economía del hogar. María se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir desde hace 30 años. Gracias a su experiencia muchas personas la prefieren. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo y para encementar el piso de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada y polines.
texts.en: María is 63 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her adult son who helps her with the household finances.  María has worked making clothing for the past 30 years.  Thanks to her experience, many people choose her products.  María is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof and cementing the floor of her house.  With the requested amount, she will purchase cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet metal and purlins.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, gravel, galvanized sheet metal and purlins to repair the roof on her house and cement the floor.

loans.name: Ma. Rica

texts.en:
Ma. Rica is 55 years old and married with six children.  With one child in school, Ma. Rica works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ma. Rica has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 9,950 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Ma. Rica is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, a 23-year-old mother of one child, has spent the past seven months operating a flea market stand selling clothing in Gokwe South, Zimbabwe. Pamela started the business of selling jackets, shirts, skirts and dresses to supplement the family income. 

During her free time, Pamela holds clean-up campaigns at the local school where she is also a Learner Guide. Learner Guides are volunteers who work in local schools teaching students life skills.

With this Kiva loan request, Pamela intends to make bulk purchases of jackets, shirts, skirts and dresses to boost her sales and profits. She hopes to eventually expand into a large retail business in order to better provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid, a 49-year-old married man, is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. A Fuzulu refugee, he   has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10  years. 

Zahid is very hard-working and passionate about his work. He considers it gratifying to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits that support his family. Zahid ’s income from business is 130 AZN each month.

Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. He has therefore applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 500 AZN to buy new fruit trees. 

In order to improve the living conditions of his family, Zahid plans to expand his business. This will require a lot of dedication and effort, and he believes that, in the near future, his sons will help him to grow the business. 

Zahid is hoping for a positive result, and thanks Kiva lenders in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy new fruit trees

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en: Jonelyn is 29 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc. Jonelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy produce of beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga, who lives with her parents and brother in the village of Bazum, located in Lori region, has been involved in hairdressing for three years. Inga receives her customers in her house, where she has a small working room. 

The requested loan will help Inga to purchase a chair and tools for her hairdressing service. It is very important for her to provide better conditions to her customers. 

The loan has now been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a chair and tools for her hairdressing service

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa, âgée de la soixantaine, s’active dans le commerce depuis plusieurs années. Elle habite un village situé à quelques 7 kilomètres de la ville. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Awa est une habituée du guichet, car elle a déjà eu à bénéficier de six crédits au niveau de l’IMCEC. 
Le commerce de la dame Awa consiste à vendre du charbon de bois, néanmoins elle cultive chaque année son champ. Elle sollicite d’ailleurs ce crédit pour l’achat de semences et engrais.
Son époux et elle s’organisent avec les recettes des activités de l’un et l’autre pour gérer les dépenses de la maison. 
Awa désire ouvrir un magasin pour vendre tout ce qui a rapport à l’agriculture : semences, engrais, pesticides et même accessoires comme les arrosoirs, les hilaires, les râteaux…
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa, who is in her sixties has been a businesswoman for several years.  She lives in a village about seven kilometres outside town. She is married with children. Awa is a regular at the loan counter, and she has already benefitted from six loans from IMCEC.
Mrs. Awa's business consists of selling charcoal; however she also cultivates her field every year.  She requests a loan to purchase seeds and fertiliser.
She and her husband manage between them to cover the household expenses with the proceeds from their various activities.
Awa would like to open a shop selling everything relating to farming: seeds, fertiliser, pesticides and even accessories such as watering cans, hoes rakes…

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser to cultivate her field in the village.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 57 years old and married with twelve children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Demetria is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Demetria has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income by buying and selling rice and dried fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted and is now requesting a PHP 9,955 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help May will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, May would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ma. Ruby

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Ruby works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Ruby is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ma. Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business.
