loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Madilene

texts.en:
Madilene is a 48-year-old, married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Madilene's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her flower shop business and is committed to regain what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 6,843 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Madilene has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Madilene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 33-year-old-married Ugandan father of four children, three of whom attend school. Although farming is his major business, he also sells fresh food to earn additional income. Price fluctuations and weather changes are his major challenges.

Peter joined the farming sector for a number of reasons, including the need to educate his children and construct a residential house. He has requested this loan to buy beans and maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to resell

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 53 years old and widowed with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Dina has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin is 28 year old and married with two kids. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). Emin does not have a higher education, since his family's financial situation made studying at university impossible.

For over four years, Emin has worked in farming, growing products that are from the local area. He has a strong desire to prosper and so he heads out to work very early and doesn't arrive home until night. Emin wants to sell top-quality products at a competitive price at the market.

He is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizers and anti-disease treatments. He will also be able to look after the crops until harvest-time. All of this will mean that Emin will earn a higher income; he can save that income in order achieve his great dream of having his own house and supporting his family in the near future. Emin is hoping for a positive result and thanks Kiva in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and anti-disease treatments

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas  es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a la actividad agropecuaria desde hace 20 años, siendo la principal actividad la producción de leche la cual le ha permitido alcanzar un nivel productivo rentable, a través del mejoramiento genético de su ganado  la atención y capacidad  alimenticia de  los mismos.
Este señor es casado con 2 hijos a los que les brinda el  apoyo necesario para su desarrollo personal. Actualmente este señor está solicitando el crédito número 9 para utilizarlo en el mantenimiento de su finca,  como es  chapias, ronda y reparación de cerca.
La cual le vendrá a dar mejores condiciones  a su infraestructura ganadera
texts.en:
Lucas is an enterprising man who has worked in agriculture for 20 years.  His main activity is milk production, and his business has reached a production level that is profitable through the improved genetics of his livestock and the care and feeding that he provides them.  

Lucas is married and has 2 children, and he provides them with the support that they need for their personal development.  At this time, he is requesting his 9th loan to use in maintaining his farm.  He will use the funds to cut and clear the land and to repair his fences.  This will enable him to improve the infrastructure of his dairy cattle farm.

loans.use: to maintain his cattle farm: to cut and clear the land and to repair the fences

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming coconuts. Lydia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell at her buy and sell vegetables business.

Ibrahim has been in this business for 15 years. Ibrahim earns more income from farming coconuts and a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ibrahim has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru: Марчона не замужняя женщина в возрасте 26 лет. Она уроженка городка Куляб. Марчона живет с родителями. Она дома принимает заказы на шитье женских платьев. Марчона любит свою работу и хочет дальше продолжать работать в этом направлении. Марчона решилась обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить новую машинку, потому что ее машинка стала плохо работать. И Марчоне, чтобы сохранить источник дохода, ей необходимо купить швейную машинку. Поддержите Марчону.
texts.en: Marjona is 26, unmarried, and a resident of the town of Kulob. She lives with her parents and takes sewing orders for women's dresses from home. She loves her work and would like to continue sewing for a living. She decided to apply for a loan to buy a new sewing machine because he old one is not working. In order for her to continue earning an income she needs to buy a new sewing machine. Support Marjona.

loans.use: to replace an old sewing machine with a new one

loans.name: Ibra

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ibra, est chauffeur de profession depuis des années. Il possède un champ qu’il exploite à chaque hivernage. Il sollicite alors pour la 5ème fois un crédit qui va lui permettre d’acheter des semences et de l’engrais pour exploiter son espace cultural.
Ibra est marié et père de famille, il vit de son activité de transport qui est permanent ; tandis que l’agriculture, il ne le fait qu’en période d’hivernage pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de son foyer. 
Ibra veut acheter un véhicule de bagages pour pouvoir faire du transport et de la vente de céréales locales un peu partout dans la région.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibra has been a driver for some  years. He owns a field that he farms every winter.
He requests this fifth loan which will enable him to purchase seeds and fertiliser to work his traditional property.
Ibra is married with children, he lives off his work as a driver, which is a permanent job ; whereas the farming is something that he only does in winter to increase his income and improve the alimentary conditions for his family.
Ibra would like to buy a utilitarian vehicle in order to be able to transport and sell his cereal all around his local region.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser for farming.

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru: Ее зовут Курбонгул. Она живет вместе с мамой, сыном и невесткой на районе Носири Хисрав. Курбонкул около 5 лет имеет свой не большой бизнес. У нее имеется не большая столовая на районе. В работе ей в основном помогают ее дети. Она как добропорядочный человек, работает честно и с намерениями расширения бизнеса старается обслужить клиентов на высшем уровне. Курбонкул хочет расширить бизнес, с путем получения кредита. Она сумму займа она приобретет столовые принадлежности.
texts.en: This is Qurbongul. She lives with her mother, son and daughter-in-law in the Nosiri Khusrav district. She has had a small business for about five years. She runs a small cafe in the area with help from her children. She is a respectable person and an honest worker who tries to provide her customers with the highest level of service with the aim of expanding her business. She wants to obtain a loan and grow her business. She will use the loan to purchase kitchen supplies.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing of various types for resale: jeans, underwear, trousers, T-shirts etc.

loans.name: Oscar Alexander

texts.es:
Oscar de 24  años de edad, se encuentra acompañado, padre de un hijo de 5 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado debido a la situacion económica que vivia su familia,  Oscar y su pareja trabajan  en un negocio de venta de panes con pollo y pupusas actividad que desarrollan desde hace dos años, de él depende su pareja y su hijo.

El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de sillas y mesas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, con lo demás del crédito comprara materia prima, como comprar panes, pollo, salsas, mayoneza, verduras, etc. El sueño de Oscar es ampliar su negocio, atraer mas clientes, dar una educación adecuada a su hijo para que este se prepare adémicamente y tengan un mejor futuro, mejorar su calidad de vida y construir su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 24 years old and in a relationship. He is the father of a five-year-old child. Oscar only completed school through the ninth grade because of his family’s financial situation. He and his partner have been working at their business of selling chicken sandwiches and “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with various fillings) for two years. His partner and child are dependent on him.

This loan will be used to buy chairs and tables so that he can provide better service to his customers. The rest of the loan will be used to buy ingredients such as bread, chicken, sauces, mayonnaise, vegetables, and other products. Oscar’s dream is to expand his business by attracting more customers. He also wants to provide an adecuate education for his son so that he will be prepared academically and have a better future. In addition, Oscar hopes to improve his quality of life and build a home of his own.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients for his food business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 25 years.

She requested 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy squash and cabbage to sell.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy squash and cabbage/

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 49 years old and has seven children. Veronica is married and all children attend school.

Veronica and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were destroyed. 

Veronica is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9,800 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs to build a house for her family. 

Veronica has been a NWTF borrower since 2010 and she plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Veronica can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Ma. Rebecca

texts.en:
Ma. Rebecca is 34 years old and married with two children; one attends school. Ma. Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo, soft drinks, and groceries.

Ma. Rebecca has been in this business for 1 year.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soft drinks, and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery products and open a grocery store

loans.name: Ma. Theresa Adoracion

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa Adoracion is a 51-year-old married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Theresa Adoracion has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, sugar, milk, and coffee.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Ma. Theresa Adoracion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, sugar, milk, and coffee.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El señor Juan es un humilde moto-taxista el cual a razón de los malos ingresos renuncio a la agricultura para convertirse en un trasportador en su pueblo. Tiene una hija de 10 años de edad por la cual ha luchado y velado y logrado mantener todo este tiempo, pero ahora se enfrente con una dificultad y es que su herramienta de trabajo ósea su motocicleta necesita reparaciones para seguir operando pues transporta persona y primero que todo hay que velar por su seguridad por ende solicita un crédito para mejorar, comprar repuestos y la mano de obra, este crédito le permitirá seguir operando en su barrio y seguir luchando por esa hija de 10 años por que tenga una mejor vida y acceda  a una educación superior
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is a humble motorcycle taxi driver. Due to the low income that he was earning, he quit being a farmer in order to provide transportation services in his town. Juan has a 10-year-old daughter, so he has strived to look after and support her this entire time. At the moment, he is facing difficulty because his vehicle is in need of repairs in order to stay in operation. The safety of his passengers is of utmost importance, which is why he is requesting a loan for these repairs. He will buy spare parts and pay for the labor.

This loan will enable him to continue operating in his neighborhood and providing for his 10-year-old daughter so that she can have a better life and have access to a superior education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for labor in order to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe and has successfully operated a clothing boutique for almost 2 years. Her business attracts many customers in her area because she sells quality items at a fair price. The products she sells include shoes, slippers, shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, baby clothes and jewelry.

Margaret is also a Camfed Learner Guide at the local school where she teaches life skills education. She is excited to use the Kiva loan to increase her inventory and improve sales. This will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and jewelry.

loans.name: Khayri

texts.ru: Она Хайри. Ей 51 год. Она уроженка района Рудаки. Там же она живет и работает. Хайри дома занимается куплей продажей скотин. Такая деятельность помогает ей зарабатывать. Она покупает телят и бычков после откармливания перепродает их с наценкой. Это является ее основным источником дохода. Во всем ее поддерживает ее муж, который на рынке "Корвон" работает продавцом. Хайри хочет получить кредит, чтобы приобрести больше скотин для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: This is Khayri. She is 51 years old and a native of the Rudaki district, where she lives and works. She buys and sells cattle and this helps her earn a living. She buys calves and bullocks and sells them for profit after fattening them. This is her main source of income. Her husband, who works at the "Korvon" market, helps her with the business. Khayri wants to get a loan in order to purchase more cattle and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
René tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a sus hijos en el Caserío Pueblo Nuevo del Distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicad en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto con su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos de ferretería, actividad que realiza hace más de 05 años, contando con clientela fija, su esposo le apoya comprando al por mayor mercadería en Morropon para luego trasladarlo hasta su distrito y ofrecerlo a un mayor precio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
René is 60 years old and lives in a common law marriage.  She lives with her children in Pueblo Nuevo in the Buenos Aires District.  The town's population works in agriculture, business and livestock.  It is located in the Morropon province in the Piura region on Peru's northern coast.

Along with her husband, she works selling hardware, a business she has been involved with for over five years.  She has a loyal customer base.  Her husband supports her by buying merchandise in bulk in Morropon to later transport back to their district to sell them at a better price.

She is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase a large amount of merchandise in order to generate greater earnings for her family.

loans.use: purchase a large amount of merchandise in order to generate greater earnings for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for general vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his plumbing work.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.en:
Farruh was born in 1992. He is a hard-working man, who always tries hard for the well-being of his family. He is not married and lives with his parents.  Farruh’s parents are poor people.  

Farruh is a student of the fourth course. He studies at the Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business.  Farruh is a student of politics.  He must pay for his tuition but he does not have the funds to do so.  In the future he wants to work in an organization.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 25 years old and married with two children. Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Alma has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Alma has taken a 9,765 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay construction costs.

Almais is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Marites has been in this business for 12 years.

She requested 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods and groceries to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now requests an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and groceries.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 49 years old and has ten children.  She is married and four of her children are in school.

Merlinda and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Merlinda is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9792.80 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour to build a house for her family. 

Merlinda has been with NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help, Merlinda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari appreciates his previous Kiva loan, that improved his living standards and enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income.

He is requesting another loan to purchase more stocks of meat for resale . He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of meat for resale.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис добросовестная женщина. Она родилась в 1988 году. Наргис замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 несовершеннолетних детей. Она начала свой собственный бизнес приготовлением и продажей разнообразных салатов 2 года назад. Так как она не смогла развевать этот тип бизнеса, она перешла на куплю продажу детской одежды. Теперь она успешно введет бизнес. Она продает детскую одежду на местном рынке. Наргис с бизнесом справляется сама. Она данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как она собирается обновить товар для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nargis is a conscientious woman who was born in 1988. She is married and has three young children. She started her own business preparing and selling a variety of cold dishes two years ago. She wasn't able to continue that kind of business and switched to buying and selling children's clothing. Now she has a successful business selling children's clothing at the local market. She runs the business all by herself. She currently needs financial support because she is getting ready to buy clothing for the new season. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy children clothes for new season

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina works hard to support her family. Marlina is widowed and has a retail rice business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 20 years.

She requested 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.  Zenaida has been in this business for 36 years.

She requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy squash and cabbage.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy squash and cabbage.

loans.name: Kashi

texts.en:
Kashi is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kashi has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past one year. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini greengrocery in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial supports.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace has been selling petrol to earn a living and she appreciates the support of her previous loan.  Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase two gallons of petrol for resale to make a profit and earn a living.

loans.use: to purchase two gallons of petrol for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widow with seven children, only one of whom is in school. Asha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Asha has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past year, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Wakati

texts.en:
This is Wakati. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to purchase more stocks of fish and kerosene for her business.

She would like to apply for another loan to buy more stocks of fish for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish for her business.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda operates a fish selling business which earns her income. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge to her business. Roda dreams of becoming a fish wholesaler in the future and she appreciates the support of her previous loan. 

With the Kshs 50,000 loan she wants to purchase three sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Ningema

texts.en:
Ningema is married and has eight children, three of whom go to school.  She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is her children's school fees.

Ningema has operated a fruit-selling business for the past six years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. 

With the loan, that she is requesting, she wants to purchase oranges, mangoes and bananas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, mangoes and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 45-year-old, vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.  However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colours and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colours and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 34-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of things such as beauty products, hair bands, clips, jewelry items, etc., at reasonable prices. She has retained a good number of customers in the three years of her business, and makes enough to provide for her family.

To fully stock her store, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR.  She will use this to buy packs of hair pins, bracelets, and whitening creams from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

Rukhsana wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of hair pins, bracelets, and whitening creams

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.en:
This is Dorcas SHG, a group of six tribal women. They all live in a small village on the outskirts of Saikul in Manipur state, which is in the northeastern part of India. They came together as a group to take a loan in order to create income activities for themselves. Rabeka is the group leader, pictured with her hand raised. She is 43 years old and the mother of three daughters and one son. Her husband is a pensioner. He gets just a meager amount. Therefore, in order to supplement the family income, Rabeka usually weaves traditional garments like wrap-around skirts, shawls and vest coats. She initiated and formed the group to fulfill the capital needs for her income activities. With her first loan in 2010, a sum of 5,000 INR she bought two piglets and with the little amount left she purchased all the requirements for weaving (loom, thread, needs). She started weaving four days a week and was able to produce six traditional wrap-arounds of different quality and four shawls in a month and a week’s time. Her husband helped her with the loan repayments for the initial months. With the profits, she was able to repay the loan and buy utensils for family use and yarn to continue weaving. With her second loan in 2011, she took 10,000 INR for weaving. She was able to produce more by channeling her sales and supplying a retailer as well as selling some herself. With her income, she managed to support her children's education better. She was able to pay the children's school fees on time and manage the household expenses. In 2012, Rabeka took her third loan of 10,000 INR to expand her weaving business. She wanted to save some from the income she earned for her children for the future. However, due to increments of educational expenses every year she couldn't do so. She wanted her eldest daughter to pursue a nursing career and her son to become an army officer.    

She is happy that her children could continue their education without having to stop due to financial obligations. Now Rabeka needs another loan to continue with her weaving business. She will use the loan to stock yarn of different colors and textures to weave the traditional wrap-around skirts, shawls and vest coats that she has been weaving. She also means to use part of the loan for the children's enrollment fees for the next session. The rest of the group members also need another loan to upgrade and do better at their respective activities. The group members' activities can be classified as weaving, piggery, variety store, ginger and yam cultivation.

loans.use: To buy yarn with different patterns and colors to weave

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en: At the age of 46, Ramzana is a hard-working, married woman. She has three children.  She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, health and clothing.  She deals in business selling milk to earn good amount of income.  At present she has two calves. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of Rs. 50,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase two more cows. This, in turn, will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase two more cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bedroom furniture for his home.

loans.name: Nyomgbo Noo Group

texts.en:
These women are part of the group called Nyogbo Noo and they are made up of women from Chorkor-Accra. The women all know one another and live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other family members. They are, on average, 36 years old, married and have at least three children.

The women sell products such as provisions, second hand clothing, pastries, foodstuff and smoked fish. As they would all like to increase the size of their businesses, the women work with the field partner, ID-Ghana. This will be their second group loan.

Vida (standing second from the left in the photo) is a member of the Nyogbo Noo Group. She sells provisions (eggs, Milo, milk, noodles, etc.). She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of provisions (eggs, Milo, milk, noodles, etc.) at the markets in Accra.  She will resell them for cash to various customers.

In addition to repaying her loan, Vida will use her earnings to pay for personal expenses and increase the working capital of her business. All the women would like to strengthen their partnership with ID-Ghana to guarantee their stock levels in the future.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of provisions (eggs, Milo, milk, noodles, etc.) at the markets in Accra.

loans.name: Zulaikha

texts.en:
Zulaikha is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. Three years ago she started a poultry business as her husband’s income is insufficient to meet their household expenditures alone. Zulaikha makes a good income to contribute toward the family expenses. 

For the improvement of her business, Zulaikha contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to build a shed roof for hens and chickens and to purchase a stock of feed for them. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good credit history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to build a shed roof for hens and chickens and to purchase a stock of feed.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. Catalina is married and has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Catalina has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

Catalina has been in this business for twenty years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  In the future, Catalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 47 years old and married with four children. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, sugar, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles and shampoo, etc. to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles and shampoo, etc. and earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing. 

Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, sugar, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles and shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 45 years old and married with five children. With one child currently in school, Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Editha has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereals, seasonings, juice, canned goods and detergent soap, etc. 

Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Elsa works hard to support her family. She has a direct-selling business vending Avon products in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing. 

Elsa, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 13000 to buy additional Avon products to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products from Avon to sell to her customers

loans.name: Katonzi Nyakabingo Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 50-year-old married father of 18 children living in Kasese, Uganda, and is a member of Katonzi Nyakabingo group. He has operated a pork butchery since 1999, a business he started to generate income for his family. High government taxes are his major challenge.

A hardworking, honest person who would love to see his working capital increase, Joseph intends to use his loan portion to buy more pigs for slaughter.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughtering

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which helped her to improve her living standards. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Nisopah Group

texts.en: This is Nisopah group. They all belong to a Tribal community and live in a small village near Saikul located on the outskirts of Senapati district in Manipur state, which is in the northeastern part of India. Ngaineng is the profiled member and she is pictured with her hand raised. She is about 40 years old and a mother to two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a farmer by profession and grows rice from an inherited paddy field. During the off season, her husband earns money on a daily wage. In order to supplement the family income, she sells rice house to house and sometimes sells in the market place. With her first loan, she bought rice grains, which she took to the mill to separate the husk from the grain. She would also sell from her granary to earn more profits. This is how the family's main source of income is generated. With her earnings, she managed her children's schooling requirements apart from the family maintenance. She needs another loan to continue her business activities. She also wishes to multiply her income activities for her future plan. With the loan, she wants to buy more stock to expand her business and sell for profit. Likewise, the rest of the group members need another loan to improve their respective income activities. Among the group members, some of them too are in the rice business and others in the weaving sector. They thank and appreciate Kiva for the constant support and generosity towards them.

loans.use: To buy unhulled rice to sell

loans.name: Mrisa

texts.en:
Mrisa is a hardworking and enterprising woman who  owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

Mrisa  sells goats to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. With this loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. Mrisa joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Besmira

texts.en:
Besmira, shown in the photograph with her adorable 4-year-old daughter, is 25 years old. She lives in a little village not far from the coastal site of Lake Ohrid in south-eastern Albania. 

Here is some information about the village.  Most of the men fish for a living; the most popular types are Koran, Belushi and little fish known locally as  'cironka’. They also raise cows and goats since the geographic terrain is suited to these animals. Apple, cherry, and walnut orchards are grown in most household.  Vegetables and grains are not grown well here because the soil is very rough.

She seeks your financial help to buy a dairy cow and purchase animal feed.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Zarine

texts.en:
Zarine has been trading in clothing since 2010. She sells clothes, shoes and different household products from her house. The assortment of goods she sells is not that big and needs to be updated and expanded periodically in order for her small business to be productive and compatible. 

Zarine currently needs a loan to buy new items (clothes and shoes) to resell to her customers. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

ZArine lives in Qajaran town with her husband and two school-aged children.

loans.use: to pay for clothes and shoes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is a 43-year-old married woman.  She is the mother of 3 children. She is a very hard working woman.

She started her business of animal sales 5 years ago to help bear her household expenditures. By this time she has attained a good number of customers. At present she has 8 goats. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.

Currently she is in her 5th loan cycle and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats

loans.name: Koussar

texts.en: Koussar has successfully built her business of tandoor with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her eighth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase stocks of flour along with packs of oil, baking powder and salts. This will enable her to increase her sales to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of flour along with packs of oil, baking powder and salts.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 56-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She is the mother of one son and one daughter, both of whom are university students. Iman and her husband have a store where they make candy. It is a very profitable business. 

Iman would like to improve the family business and expand it. She took a loan from FATEN, which will help her and her husband to buy a machine for grinding coffee for their project. By taking this loan, they will be able to open a new production line and expand their business.

Iman appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a machine for grinding coffee

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of ready to wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase more ready to wear like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell. 

Erlinda has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from direct selling Avon and herbal products.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear like blouses, shorts, and t-shirts to sell

loans.name: Rubango Tweyombeke Group

texts.en: Siira is a married man with three children who grows maize and Irish potatoes. He is living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a primary school teacher and earns a salary from the government. He is a member of a village bank group where members without security get a loan through group guarantorship. He is faced with the problem of paying school fees for his children to have his dream of educating his children fulfilled because his salary is not enough. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 38 years old and has two children who are both in school.

Evangeline has a used clothing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for one year. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with five children, four are in school and one is an infant.

Christine sells goat meat to her neighbours and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 42-year-old married mother of seven children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past year she has operated a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

The recipient of five previous loans from NWTF, Josephine has requested a new one for PHP 12000 to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bwizi Trader Group

texts.en: Moses is a married man with five children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in a retail shop business for eight years dealing in soap, sugar and salt, which he started with capital from savings in their group and now has grown. He obtains additional income from farming where he grows maize and has been member of a village group where members save and guarantee one another to get a loan. He experiences high transport costs due to the long distances to the urban centers to buy his products since he is in a rural area. In spite of this, his vision is to be economically well off. Moses needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cupboard for his house.

loans.name: Aishe

texts.en:
Aishe is a 47-year-old villager and a widowed mother of four who needs your help to buy a dairy cow and a calf. 

Her husband died 15 years ago and she needed to  raise her children on her own and take care of her blind mother-in-law.  Aishe told the Branch Assistant interviewer that “It was very difficult at first; my youngest one was a couple months old. My parents and siblings could not help financially since they were poor. It took me awhile to establish my new routine,”  

Aishe owns about 3 agricultural plots and grows white beans, grains, and seasonal vegetables.  In addition, she has  walnut, apple, pear, cherry, and plum orchards and grapevines.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Samreen

texts.en:
Samreen is a 20-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Since 2008, Anahit has been trading women’s clothing and underwear from her house in Vanadzor town. In the past, Anahit used to travel to neighboring countries to purchase inventory. Now, she puts her orders through other traders so she can spend more time managing the business here.

Currently Anahit requires new stock for her business. With a good credit history behind her to help her finance the inventory order, Anahit has applied to SEF International for a loan.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a widow with two children who are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.
 
Umazi has operated a milk selling business at the market for the past ten years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase gallons of milk for resale.  She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of milk for resale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana is married and has a ready-to-wear clothes selling business in the Philippines.

Susana has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

Susana has been in this business for six years now.

Susana would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John a 40-year-old-male who is married with six children, four of whom are attending school. John has a retail shop and works seven days a week. He operates a bar as an additional source of income. John began the business to generate income for the family. He is accessing a loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, and bread to sell. Educating his children and expanding his business are his future plans. John is a hardworking person. However, debts plus price fluctuations affect his profit margin.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans and bread to sell

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is an enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy thread, fabric and needles for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric and needles

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is married with seven children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past five years, she has operated a home-based mat weaving business. The changing weather conditions are an ongoing challenge to her business. 

With the loan, she will purchase bulk quantities of materials for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of materials for her business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a widowed woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sweets, and biscuits for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sweets, and biscuits for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine operates a clothes-selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She appreciates the support of the previous loan. 

With this loan, she is requesting KES 50,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
For 11 years, Gayane has sold fruits and vegetables. She rents a shop in one of the busy parts of the town of Alaverdi. She works with various grocery distributors on a credit sales. Her clients' demands are growing each day and Gayane wants to increase the assortment of products in her shop. she also wants to  buy displays to better present her merchandise. 

Gayane lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two young grandsons. Her family members help with her selling business. 

Gayane's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and purchase displays to better present her merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flagstone and cement to renovate the inside of his home.

loans.name: Osu Nyame Group

texts.en:
These women are part of a 6-member female group called Osu Nyame.  They are friends and live in the same neighborhood. This is the fifth time that the group has requested a loan from the field partner, ID-Ghana, in order to increase the size of their businesses. They trade in provisions, vegetables, bread, wigs and hair products, cosmetics, kenkey (cooked maize paste) and fish.

Martha is the group representative. She is 31 years old and married to Daniel. They have three children (all attend school) and financially provide for them.    Martha and her husband live together with their children and meet the household expenses. Martha attended school infrequently. 

Nearly five years ago, she began selling cosmetics from door to door. This has enabled her to provide for her family without too much difficulty. Due to the high level of customer demand, Martha would like to expand her business. She has requested a fifth group loan.   The previous loans were fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics from the markets and sell them door-to-door.

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr:
Ousseynou est le nom de l’emprunteur qui vient pour la première fois pour solliciter les services de l’IMCEC afin de pouvoir réparer sa voiture. Il est chauffeur depuis un bon bout de temps et a de l’expérience sur ce domaine. Avec ce montant, il pourra changer le moteur du véhicule, mais aussi refaire la tôlerie. 
Ousseynou est marié et a des enfants qu’il prend en charge grâce aux revenus qu’apporte le véhicule qu’il conduit lui-même.
Dans l’avenir, Ousseynou, veut devenir un grand transporteur et avoir un large parc automobile.
texts.en:
Ousseynou is the name of this candidate who requests a first loan from IMCEC  to repair his car. He has been a driver for quite a long while and has much experience in this field. This credit will enable him to change the motor of the vehicle and also to repair the bodywork.
Ousseynou is married with children. His income from the vehicle that he drives himself enables him to provide for his children.
In the future, Ousseynou would like to have a big transport business with many vehicles.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Mersa

texts.en:
Mersa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a frozen foods and dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Mersa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish and packs of frozen foods to sell.

Mersa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with six children; five attend school and one child is not yet school aged.  She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

She has operated a fish selling business for two years and sells at the local market.  A major challenge to her business is the changing seasons. 

She will use the loan to purchase fish for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 51 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

Ma. Luisa's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ma. Luisa has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 9874 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home.

Ma. Luisa is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia is 35 years old and married with three children.  With two children attending school, Remia works very hard to provide for them.

Remia's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Remia has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Remia has taken a 9,905 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

Remiais committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi operates a grocery and vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the KES 15,000, she wants to buy green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for sale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She is a married mother of four children, three of whom are in school and one who is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Mwanamisi bakes cakes and sells them to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

Mwanamisi is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Aníbal tiene 24 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico cliente vive con su conyugue y sus hijos en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado caprino, la compra lo realiza en su caserío y la venta lo realiza en el Caserío de Chiple, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alterntiva de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alambre para cercar el corral de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Anibal, 24, lives in his own home, which is made of rudimentary materials.  He lives with his wife and children in the Pucara district.  Here, the residents work in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry.  This district is in Jaen province, in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru.

Anibal works raising and selling goats.  He makes his purchases in his rural settlement, and he sells his livestock in the town of Chiple.  He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 Peruvian soles to buy wire to enclose the corral where he keeps his animals.  In this way, he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy wire to enclose his corral

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson, who is a thirty-one-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used his previous loan to buy more crates of soda and beer to sell. He still operates a bar as his main source of income alongside operating a taxi and farming to earn an extra living. 

He has a challenge of increased prices of soda and beer. He has dreams of meeting his family's needs and educating his children through higher institutions of learning.

He is requesting a loan to buy more crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 52 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, Carmelita works very hard to provide for the family.

Carmelita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Carmelita has taken a PHP 9800 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home.

Carmelita is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en:
Peluce, 42 years old, is a married Ugandan lady with 4 children between the ages 25 and 4 years; all attend school. 

She owns a lodge and operates a saloon to earn additional income. She became a  business woman to provide for her family. She has limited capital and wants a loan to buy more beds and other equipment for her hotel. This will enable her to be competitive and overcome business challenges.

loans.use: to buy more beds and other equipment for her hotel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an air-conditioner for the house.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. 

Sherlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) . She is borrowing 11,000 Philippine peso through NWTF to purchase more stock of peanuts to sell. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She sells purified drinking water and earns additional income operating a general store. Teresita requests 11,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase purified drinking water to sell.

Teresita has sustained her business activities through 5 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase  purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam used the previous loan to pay workers to help him quarry stones. He works in a quarry and  farms to earn an income and support his family.

Poor roads and lack of capital to hire manpower pose challenges to his business growth.   His dreams are to educate his children and expand his business. 

Sam needs a loan to pay workers who help him quarry stones.

loans.use: to  pay workers who are helping him quarry stones.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a 28-year-old married man with one child living in Fort Portal Uganda. He deals in agriculture and transport, and also rentals. 

He faces challenges of unpredictable weather changes. However, he hopes to finish construction of his house. 

Johnson needs a loan to buy peas for planting.

loans.use: to buy peas for planting.

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Besides the retail shop business, she operates a charcoal selling business. She is asking for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for her business. 

She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 23 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and eight siblings in Mafraq, Jordan. 

He is a university student majoring in Arabic language, and he is in his first year. 

Mahmoud is seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees in order to be able to work in his study field after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Julia Delisia

texts.es:
Julia Delisia tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa, norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y abarrotes, desde hace 7 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Julia Delisia is 42 years old. She lives in the district of Buenos Aires, a community dedicated to agriculture, trading and cattle farming. It is located in the province of Morropon of the Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.

Julia has made a living by selling beer and groceries for the last 7 years. Her store is based out of her home, and she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 Nuevos Soles (PEN) to buy a larger quantity of beer that will help her generate a larger income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beer that will help her generate a larger income for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair and renovate his flat.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, María, belongs to the "Kimoyganakera Maganiroigi" communal bank. The bank is located in the Echarate district, which is part of the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

María earns her living running a grocery store. She sells basic everyday products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She has had this business for five years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the grocery store. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. 

The member would like to be able to continue working so that she can support her family. This loan is part of one of Asociación Arariwa's lines of credit, called Credi Yapa. This line of credit is granted to borrowers with a good credit record.

María is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Abdias

texts.es:
Abdías tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de maíz, en la parte posterior de su domicilio tiene una parcela que lo cultiva desde unos años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de semillas que le permitirán sembrar en mayor cantidad y pagar a jornaleros por la siembra y mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Abdias, 44, lives in the Querocotillo district—a community comprised of farmers, vendors, and cattle-raisers. It is located in the Cutervo Province, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in northern Peru.

He makes a living as a corn farmer. In the back of his house, he has a parcel of land that he has cultivated for years. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy seeds that will allow him to plant higher quantities and to pay workers to plant and maintain his corn crop. This will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and to pay workers to maintain his corn crops.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet, aged twenty-six years, used the previous loan to buy general merchandise for resale. After realizing that her business needs constant restocking due to an increase in demand, she is requesting another loan  to buy  more salt and soap  for resale. Like other people in the retail business, Juliet meets a difficulty of price fluctuations and inadequate capital for expansion which delays her dream of becoming a wholesale trader.

loans.use: to buy  more salt and soap  for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flagstones and cement to renovate his house from the inside.

loans.name: Dromo Naa Group

texts.en:
These women are also part of the group called Dromo Naa and they are women from Chorkor-Accra. The women all know one another and live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other family members. They are, on average, 49 years old, married and have at least one dependent child. 

The women sell products such as material, foodstuffs, sandals, soft drinks, general goods, and frozen foods. As they would all like to increase the size of their businesses, the women work with the field partner, ID-Ghana. This will be their second group loan. Mary (standing first from the left in the photo) is a member of the Dromo Naa Group. She sells foodstuffs (assorted). She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of assorted foodstuffs at the markets in Accra. She will resell them for cash to various customers. In addition to repaying her loan, Mary will use her earnings to pay for personal expenses and increase the working capital of her business. All the women would like to strengthen their partnership with ID-Ghana to guarantee their stock levels in the future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of assorted foodstuffs at the markets in Accra for resale.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is married and has six school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Nadzuwa has operated a fruit-selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She is requesting this loan to purchase oranges, mangoes, bananas, and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, mangoes, bananas, and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Ferbiola

texts.en:
Ferbiola is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a kiosk shop business selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, and rice for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, and rice for resale

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Chaque année, cet emprunteur, appelé Mamadou, cultive son champ situé à environ 7km de la ville. Ayant besoin d’un matériel agricole et de semences, mais aussi de pesticides et engrais, il se tourne vers IMCEC pour pouvoir satisfaire son besoin.
Mamadou est marié et père de famille dont il gère les besoins quotidiens. Il a sa femme qui l’appuie dans les petites dépenses du foyer.
Mamadou voudrai diversifier son activité et faire du commerce de denrées alimentaires : c’est le projet qu’il nourrit pour l’avenir et pense pouvoir le réaliser avec l’aide d’une Institution financière comme L’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Every year this candidate named Mamadou, cultivates his field that is about seven kilometres out of town. As he needs farming materials as well as seeds, pesticides and fertiliser, he requests assistance from IMCEC to obtain a loan.
Mamadou is married with children and he provides for their daily needs. His wife helps him with the petty household expenses.
Mamadou would like to branch out and sell food products: this is his project for the future and he feels capable of doing it with the help of a financial institution such as the IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy farming material, seeds and fertiliser, and pesticides to prepare for the winter .

loans.name: Eria

texts.en:
Eria is aged 33 years and is married with three children, two of whom attend school.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda.

Eria is a teacher by profession. He works eight hours a day and five days a week. He has been in a farming business for nine years to add to his income. Eria likes the teaching profession, having been inspired by his love for children.

Eria is asking for a loan to pay school fees for his children as he is limited by the low salary payments.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es: josé tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 meses y un año y medio de edad. José es un hombre muy trabajador quien trabaja como agricultor y además trabaja en una ladrillera desde hace mucho tiempo. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, y para pagar la mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en: José is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children of 7 months and one and a half years. José is a very hardworking man who works as a farmer and has also worked in a brick factory for a long time. With the desire of improving his living conditions, he has made the decision to apply for this loan from FUSAI to invest it in the construction of a fourth room, for which he needs materials like: bricks, cement, sand, iron and to pay for construction labor.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with six school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, justo con su conyugue y sus 4 menores hijos de 14,11, 9, 6 años de edad de los cuales el primero cursa secundaria y los otros dos primaria en colegio nacional en el Caserío Cabra Chica distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, desde hace varios años, su esposa le apoya en este rubro, cocinando para asistir a los jornaleros que trabajan dando mantenimiento a su cultivo de piña y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.

Ha solicitado un prestamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para el pago a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de sus cultivo de piña y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 34, he lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his spouse and their four young children, aged 14, 11, 9 and 6. The first is in secondary school and the other two are in primary, in the national school. In the Cabra Chica village of Pucará district, the population makes it living in agriculture, business and animal husbandry. It is located in the province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca region, northern sierra of Peru.

He has worked in agriculture, specifically in growing pineapple, for the past several years. His wife helps him with this work, cooking to attend to the day laborers who work, giving maintenance to his pineapple crop and, in this manner, generating income for the family.

He has applied for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles for paying day laborers for the maintenance of his pineapple crop and, in this manner, to generate more income.

loans.use: to pay day laborers for the maintenance of his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 39-year-old married woman with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Agnes sells secondhand clothes and has been in that business since 2011. She is working very hard towards the expansion of her business. She hopes to build a residential house for her children. She is faced with the challenges of price fluctuation and seasonality factors. She increases her sales at the end of the month, when salaries are paid. Agnes needs a loan to buy secondhand shirts, blouses, skirts and dresses to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand shirts, blouses, skirts and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 37-year-old widowed woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

For 17 years she has been operating a food vending business, a business she started after losing her husband, on realizing that farming could not facilitate her in meeting the family's daily expenses.
