Price fluctuation coupled with inadequate capital pose a challenge to her business growth while her dreams are educating her children and owning a retail shop. 

Racheal intends to use the loan to buy tomatoes, bananas, egg plants and onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, bananas, egg plants, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build on her land.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 38-year-old married woman with four children, and runs a shoe business in Kasese, Uganda. She has operated the business since 2000, after realizing that the income brought in by her husband is not enough to sustain their family. Instability in prices coupled with inadequate capital pose a challenge to her business growth. 

Loice dreams of educating her children and expanding her business. She intends to use the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more stock of makuti (roof-thatch materials) for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of makuti (roof-thatch materials) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery items most needed by her community.

loans.name: Colirios Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas, lo coordina la señora Nohemí, mujer emprendedora de 28 años de edad y casada, se dedica a comercializar repostería de manera ambulante en el municipio y zonas franca, este negocio lo impulso hace cuatro años, pues trabajo en la zona y de los ingresos obtenido impulso el negocio, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de picos, empanadas, pan de manjar, tortas, etc. Otra de  las socias es la señora Patricia 39 años de edad, quien elabora piñatas y vende flores, tiene cinco años de experiencia en su negocio y la señora Patricia de 22 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio inicio el negocio hace dos años.
texts.en:
This village bank is made up of three hardworking members. It is coordinated by Nohemí, an enterprising woman of 28 and married. She works in retailing baked goods as a street vendor in the town and nearby areas. She started this business four years ago. She works in the area and the income obtained propels the business. She requires the loan for the purchase of pastries, empanadas, breads, rolls, etc.

Another one of the members is Patricia, 39 years old, who makes piñatas and sells flowers. She has five years' experience in her business. Patricia, 22 years old, is the owner of a small grocery store in her home, which she started two years ago.

loans.use: to buy pastries, empanadas, breads, rolls, etc.

loans.name: Elena Hermida

texts.es:
Elena Hermida tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta, como tumbos, guabas, maracuyás, desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de variedad de frutas y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elena Hermida is 47 years old and is married with three children. She lives with her family in the district of Oyotún, an area where most people work in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle. It is located two hours from the capital of the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Elena Hermida has worked for many years selling fruit such as tumbo (also called banana passionfruit or banana poka), guava, and passionfruit. Her business is located in her home. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in order to buy a greater amount of a variety of fruits and thus generate more income for her family.

loans.use: buy more fruit.

loans.name: Twiteganyirize Cb Group

texts.en:
Drocelle is 35 years old and is a mother of five children aged between five and sixteen years old. 

Drocelle is the leader of a group called Twiteganyirize - which means "Save for the future" in English. They all belong to one group but they own different business types, and they have been praising their ability of doing small business with the help of micro loans. Drocelle sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and millet to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

In the group photo, Drocelle holds a piece of paper as a sign of identification from her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, sorghum and millet to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his tomato garden.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old, and is married with three children who all attend school. They live in Kasese-Uganda. 

Mary has been operating a cosmetic shop since 2000 to supplement the family income. She is a hard working woman, although she is faced with the challenge of high competition and general price fluctuations. She is looking forward to expand her business in order to increase the family's income. Mary intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah operates a food stall and a vegetable stall. She appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy potatoes, onions, vegetables and tomatoes to re-sell. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, vegetables and tomatoes to re-sell.

loans.name: Jeovanny Alberto

texts.es:
Jeovanny de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato general, está soltero y solamente vive con su madre que depende de él.

Jeovanny, es un joven que trabaja de carpintero desde hace 15 años, este negocio lo ha aprendido del papá ya que él también ejerce este oficio y vio las ganancias que se obtienen haciendo este trabajo, la actividad la realizan de 7 de la mañana a 4 d ella tarde.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar más madera para surtir la carpintería, pues quiere elaborar muchos muebles para ser reconocido y aumentar la clientela.

Su sueño es que su negocio de carpintería vaya mejorando y si es posible poder exportar los muebles a otros países.
texts.en:
Jeovanny is 28 years old and obtained his general high school education. He is single and his mother is the only financial dependent living with him.

Jeovanny is a young man who has worked in carpentry for 15 years, having learned the trade from his father. He decided to follow in the same line of work when he saw the amount of income that he could earn. Jeovanny works from 7:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wood in order to restock his carpentry shop. He wants to produce more furniture pieces so that he can become recognized and increase his clientele. His dream is to improve his carpentry business and be able to export furniture to other countries if possible.

loans.use: to buy wood in order to restock his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs intended for resale

loans.name: Jockus

texts.en:
Jockus is 23 years old and is married with one child. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Jockus operates a cosmetics shop and deals in baby clothes as well. He has been in the business for five years. He started the business to become rich and support his family. He intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Being in a competitive market, he faces the challenges of inadequate capital for expansion and competition. Jockus dreams of wholesale trading in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Salivin

texts.en: Salivin is a forty-one-year old married man with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop which he has operated since 2004. He supplements his income generation with cocoa farming, which has assisted him in the maintenance of his family's basic needs. He dreams of expanding his shop to a very big store and of educating his children to high levels of learning. Though he has maintained his business, limited capital affects him. He needs a loan to buy salt, vaseline and biscuits to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy salt, vaseline and biscuits to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Perlas Preciosas San Pedro Group

texts.en:
“Perlas Preciosas San Pedro", meaning “Precious Pearls from San Padro”, is the name of a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank located in the lovely town of San Pedro La Laguna on the shores of Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. The nine women in the Trust Bank work in various small businesses, including the production and sale of handicrafts and traditional textiles, as well as a tortilla storefront where tortillas are freshly made and sold three times each day. Another lady has a convenience store where items for everyday consumption are sold. 

Petrona, who is married with four children, is a motivated member of the Trust Bank. As the family is quite large and her husband’s earnings are not enough, Petrona has a clothing store. She is also a nurse. Petrona is starting her first loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and is requesting a loan which she will use to buy clothing to resell, including pants, shirts and tee shirts. She also sells traditional clothing. Petrona is most aware that this is a perfect time to sell to the influx of visitors that come to San Pedro at this time of the year because it is the “Fair of the Villages”, and sales will increase. She wants to realize increased income by having enough inventory.

The women in the Trust Bank are very aware of the value of education and its impact on themselves and their children. Petrona has a daughter who is about to graduate from high school this year. The women have had little or no education. They are most pleased not only to receive financial capital in the form of the small loans but also to participate in the non-formal educational component of their monthly meetings. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer joins the ladies and shares information about business and money management, marketing, pricing and customer service. They also learn about women’s health, self esteem and domestic violence. The combination of the loans and education is called “Microcredit Plus” and it is unique to Friendship Bridge.

All of the ladies in the Trust Bank look forward to empowering themselves and eliminating poverty in their lives. The support of KIVA investors and Friendship Bridge is so very valuable and the women are most appreciative. Thank you to each KIVA investor!

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell, including pants, shirts and tee shirts.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is a 26-year-old businesswoman. She lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her husband and two children. She has been successfully running a grocery shop for six months now. Precious also volunteers in her spare time teaching life skills to students in local schools. 

With the requested Kiva loan, she plans to purchase groceries such as sugar, salt, flour, cooking oil and milk in bulk to sell, which will help to reduce costs and increase profits. With the additional profits she intends to build her own shop and employ a person from her community to assist her in the business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell, such as sugar, salt, flour, cooking oil and milk.

loans.name: Lorcadia

texts.en:
Lorcadia is 23 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. 

Lorcadia has been successfully running her grocery shop for four months now with assistance from her husband. Locadia also volunteers her spare time delivering guidance counselling sessions to students in schools, as well as offering catering services during school functions. 

With the requested Kiva loan she will purchase groceries such as sugar, salt, flour, cooking oil and milk in bulk, which will help to reduce costs and increase profits. With additional profits she intends to build her own shop and stop renting.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as sugar, salt, flour, cooking oil and milk.

loans.name: Kudzai

texts.en:
Kudzai is a 17-year-old businesswoman residing in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. For the past seven months she has been successfully running a flea market stall selling clothing with assistance from her parents. Kudzai also volunteers her spare time assisting girls with life skills and cleaning the schoolyard. 

With the requested Kiva loan she will purchase quality and fashionable clothing from South Africa to meet customer demand and improve sales. With the additional profits she hopes to own a boutique and help meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase quality and fashionable clothing from South Africa to meet customer demand and improve sales.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a 19-year-old businesswoman. She is a mother of one, living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe.

Eugenia has been successfully rearing broiler chickens for five months now with assistance from her family. She keeps the chickens in batches of 25 birds that she sells every six weeks. Eugenia is a also a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, and volunteers assisting girls in life skills education. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Eugenia intends to increase her poultry production from a monthly basis to weekly, so as to meet customer demand and boost profits. With additional profits she aims to purchase more land to raise the broiler chicks and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to increase her poultry production from a monthly basis to weekly so as to meet customer demand and boost profits.

loans.name: Mariana Group

texts.en:
Santa Maria Visitacion is a municipality in the Department of Sololá in the Highlands of Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust bank, “Mariana”, has been formed here and is composed of eight dynamic close friends who have been together for several years. They have recently welcomed a new member to the group.

Juana is a 45-year-old President of the Trust Bank who is married with one child. For several years, Juana has been involved in the production of traditional colorful textiles which she fabricates by hand. Because of her beautifully crafted and elaborate designs, her work is in high demand, even though it is a bit more costly to her customers. As her business is enjoying increased success, she has hired three of her sisters. Juana is applying for a new loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to purchase a wide variety of thread, yarn and other supplies. She shares, "I am so grateful to Friendship Bridge and to all the people who support the organization, because they are supporting so many women. The results of our hard work may not be immediately visible, but we are working very hard to maintain and improve our small businesses. Thank you, KIVA, for trusting us and for funding our loans.”

The ladies of the “Mariana” Trust Bank meet each month to make payments on their loans and participate in educational seminars. As most of them have had little or no education, they are motivated to learn how to manage their loans, and so the information provided by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer is most useful and helpful. The women learn about budgeting, marketing, pricing and customer service. They also learn about indebtedness. Their home lives are enhanced when they learn about hygiene, health and nutrition as well as the use of medicinal plants. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus”, and it is a partnership that is most effective.

Having been through several loan cycles with Friendship Bridge, the ladies of the “Mariana” Trust Bank have proven themselves to be responsible and trustworthy. They anticipate that this new loan cycle will be very successful, both for themselves and their businesses. Thank you, KIVA investors, for your generosity in funding their loans!

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of thread, yarn and other supplies.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is a 25-year-old businesswoman living in the Kwekwe District in Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for one year now. Helena volunteers her spare time delivering wellbeing and life skills sessions to students in local schools. With the requested Kiva loan she plans to purchase groceries in bulk that are most needed by her community, including flour, cooking oil, salt and sugar to cut down on costs and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Buhle

texts.en: Buhle is a 19 -year-old businesswoman residing in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a grocery shop for eight months now with the assistance of her brother. Buhle volunteers her spare time assisting in washing, cleaning and gardening at the old people’s home that is located in her community. With the requested Kiva loan she will purchase grocery items in bulk. With her increase in profits she hopes to run her own supermarket and employ people from her community.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items in bulk so as to increase sales.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah, age 38, is a female, married with six children, and living in Kasese-Uganda. Norah has been in her shoe business since 1990. She began the business to enable her to pay school fees for her children after her husband failed to fulfill his obligation. She is a hardworking woman who is looking forward to educating her children and building a residential house, and to have improved standards of living. Norah intends to use the loan to buy shoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy shoes for selling.

loans.name: Mario Felipe

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido.  Cada día Mario trabaja con mucho entusiasmo y esfuerzo ya que el es agricultor, sobre todo porque este humilde trabajo es su única fuente de ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, el siembra, cultiva y compra y vende productos como frejol, arroz y otros productos tradicionales de su ciudad.

Mario está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que es la tercera vez que le brindan su apoyo y gracias a ello podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, semillas, entre otros y de esta manera podrá tener un mejor cultivo y podrá mejorar su cosecha y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Mario is a hardworking man who lives in the city of Camaná, which is known for its warm climate. Each day Mario works with great enthusiasm and effort as a farmer. Most all, his modest work is the only source of income that he has to help his family move forward. Mario plants, cultivates, buys, and sells products such as beans, rice, and other traditional crops from his city.

He is grateful to the Kiva lenders since this is the third time that he has requested their support. Thanks to them, he will be able to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, and other supplies so that he can have a better crop and improve his harvest. Mario continues to strive toward fulfilling his greatest wish of finishing the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, and other supplies.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: Amalia tiene 48 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo. Amalia posee una pequeña tienda en la cual distribuye productos de primera necesidad. Tiene 8 años de contar con la tienda por lo que ya es muy conocida en la zona y muchas personas la prefieren. Amalia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera, polines,etc.
texts.en: Amalia is 48 years old and she lives with her husband in a house they own. Amalia owns a small store from which she sells everyday goods and necessities. She has run the store for 8 years and is well known in the area, as many people like to shop there. Amalia is asking for this loan from FUSAI (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in repairs to the roof of her house, for which she needs materials like sheets of galvanized metal, wood, wooden poles, etc.

loans.use: buy sheets of galvanized metal, wood, wooden poles, etc. to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 27-year-old single male with no child, living in Kasese, Uganda. Stephen is a banker and has been in that service for one year. He practices farming for an additional source of income. He is in that service because it's in line with his profession. Stephen wants to improve the standards of living of his family, so that’s why he intends to use a loan to pay school fees for his brother. Stephen is a hardworking man who faces the challenge of working long hours.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his brother.

loans.name: Sinikiwe

texts.en:
Sinikiwe is a 17-year-old businesswoman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a stall at the local flea market for seven months now with assistance from her family members. When she is not working at the flea market, Sinikiwe volunteers by cleaning the school and clinic yards. 

With the requested Kiva loan, she will purchase high quality and fashionable clothes, helping her to become more competitive and attract more customers. With the additional profits she wants to own her own boutique and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock for her clothing stall.

loans.name: Fungai

texts.en:
Fungai is 26 years old, and is a single mother with one child, She lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. 

Fungai is a member of Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) and a businesswoman. She has been successfully selling clothes for eight months now at her local market. She was encouraged by other Cama members to venture into business so that she could better provide for herself and her child. During her spare time Fungai also volunteers at local schools where she helps clean the toilets. 

With the requested loan, Fungai intends to buy more clothes, blankets and shoes to sell, which will help to boost her sales and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, blankets and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Perseverance

texts.en:
Perseverance is a 20-year-old businesswoman. She is married and lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her husband. With assistance from her family members she has been successfully running a grocery shop for six months now. Perseverance also volunteers her spare time cleaning school premises within her community. 

With the requested Kiva loan she will purchase more grocery items in bulk. With additional profits she intends to run her own supermarket and employ people from her community.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items in bulk so as to increase her sales.

loans.name: Twalibu

texts.en: Twalibu is a thirty-four-year-old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop, does cocoa farming and gets a salary to earn a living. This has assisted him in running his business, though competition in his area is still a problem for his growth. He wishes to expand his business to new markets and attract many customers. Twalibu intends to use the loan to buy electronic torches, vests for men and toilet paper to sell.

loans.use: to buy electronic torches, vests for men and toilet paper to sell.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en: Yvette is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for three months now with assistance from her mother. Yvette volunteers her spare time delivering guidance and counselling sessions to the youth in her community. With the requested Kiva loan she will purchase large quantities of grocery items to cut down on costs and improve profits. With the additional profits she aims to open her own supermarket and employ people from her community.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 21-year-old mother of one, living in the Kwekwe district of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully rearing broiler chickens for 3 months with assistance from her husband. Currently she is producing 25 broiler chickens every 6 weeks. Susan also volunteers: cleaning the school and clinic yards as well as fetching water for the elderly. With the requested Kiva loan, she will increase poultry production from a monthly basis to a weekly basis so as to meet customer demand and boost profits. She intends to expand her business into a poultry shop and improve the quality of life of her family with the additional profits.

loans.use: to increase poultry production

loans.name: Silo Marty

texts.es:
Silo Marty tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos y pavos, desde hace más de 03 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alterntiva de 2 600 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento y arena para terminar de construir una pared de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Silo Marty is 33 years old and lives in the district of Zaña, a community where most people work in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Silo Marty has worked for more than 3 years raising and selling small animals like ducks and turkeys. His business is located in the back part of his property. He has asked for a loan of 2600 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in order to buy construction materials such as cement and sand to finish building one wall of his house.

loans.use: buy materials to continue construction of his house.

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina viene de una familia humilde, y trabajadora, se encuentra trabajando como empleada de una empresa distribuidora, y a la vez estudia para poder realizarse como persona y profesional.
Está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniera Industrial, y comenta que su aspiración es terminar su carrera y comenzar a trabajar en forma independiente y ser una profesional muy destacada en su campo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención, como fotocopias, libros y demás.
texts.en:
Romina comes from a humble and hardworking family. She is working as an employee in a distribution company, and at the same time studies in order to develop herself and become a professional. 

She is majoring in Industrial Engineering, and says that her aspiration is to finish her degree, start working independently, and become a distinguished professional in her field. 

She is asking for this loan to invest in the payments of her university tuition, and also to be able to cover her school expenses, such as photocopies, books and other items.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition and to cover other school expenses

loans.name: Axcelia

texts.en: Axcelia is an 18-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. As a Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member, she has been successfully selling secondhand clothing for five months now. She was encouraged by other Cama members to venture into business so that she could look after herself and turn the tide of poverty in her family. During her spare time, she volunteers as a community health activist disseminating health information to people in her village. With the requested loan, Axcelia intends to buy more secondhand clothing to boost her sales. With the additional profits, she intends to better provide for herself and her siblings.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothing to boost her sales.

loans.name: Kudzai

texts.en: Kudzai is a 25-year-old businesswoman. She is married with one child and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothes for seven months. She was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into business so that she could look after herself and provide for her family. In her spare time, Kudzai volunteers as a Community Health Trainer at local schools within the community disseminating health information. With the requested loan, Kudzai intends to buy more clothes and blankets in order to increase sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Santos Samuel

texts.es: Santos tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre. Santos es un hombre muy trabajador quien se gana la vida como jornalero desde hace muco tiempo. Santos solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para el cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, etc. Espera contar con el crédito y así dar inicio a la construcción.
texts.en: Santos is 40 years old and lives in his own house together with his mother. Santos is a very hardworking man who has made a living as a laborer for a very long time. Santos requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a bedroom, for which he needs to buy materials such as: bricks, cement, sand, iron, etc. He hopes to receive the loan so he can start the construction.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, etc. to construct a bedroom

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Ñuruñupe, una zona rural del distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de maiz, el cual se encuentran con 120 días de sembrado, dichos productos son comercializados en el distrito de San Felipe, dichos cultivos se encuentran en muy buen estado, cuenta con experiencia en la agricultura, además el cliente se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar como son yuca, frejol, los cuales son para su consumo, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para el pago a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Valentin is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children in Caserio de Nurunupe, a rural zone in the district of Zana, a community that engages in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming, located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the region Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

He makes a living in agriculture, through crops of corn, which require 120 days from sowing. These products are marketed in the district of San Felipe. His crops are in very good condition. He has experience in agriculture, and in addition he grows other crops like yucca and beans, which are for his consumption. He has very good personal references.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 nuevos soles to pay day laborers for the maintenance of his corn crop and in this way he hopes to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay day laborers to maintain his corn crop

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flow of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result, school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

James is married and has nine children. He runs a small kiosk while his wife runs a small business where she sells cereals. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 10 years now and they are currently growing maize, soybeans, sunflower, bananas and trees. James is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food.

This is James’ first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to expand his business. James’ hope for the future is to own a private school.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Todozia

texts.en:
Todozia is a 36-year-old married woman with seven children, five of whom attend school. 

Todozia has a retail shop where she works eleven hours a day, seven days a week. She does farming for additional income. She began the business to have a source of income, as she dreams of educating her children. 

Todozia needs a loan to buy shirts, blouses and dresses sell. She complains of inadequate capital and high license fees, yet sometimes the sales are so low.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. 

Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Thomas, a father of five children, runs a motorbike transport business, while his wife has been a farmer for 15 years now; they are currently growing maize, beans and sunflowers. 

Thomas is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine. This is his first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Thomas’ hope for the future is to gain new skills in beekeeping and improve his children’s education.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: La Realidad Group

texts.es: Al grupo lo integran cuatro socios emprendedores, lo coordina el señor José de 48 años de edad y acompañado, se dedica a la venta de tamales en el mercado de la municipalidad, el crédito lo invertirá en materia prima como quintal de maíz, hojas de chagüite, leña, atado de dulce, bolsas, etc., con los créditos obtenidos en la institución ha logrado aumentar sus ganancias porque le ha permitido invertir al por mayor. Los otros integrantes son las señoras Marlin 30 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, Nubia de 62 años de edad dedicada a la venta de nacatamales en el domicilio y de manera ambulante en la capital, y el señor Juan de 53 años, quien se dedica a la venta de tamales y pan en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The group is made up of four enterprising members coordinated by José, who is 48 years old and in a relationship.

José makes a living selling tamales in the town market.  He'll invest the loan in ingredients: a quintal of corn, banana leaves, firewood, unrefined whole cane sugar, bags, etc.  With the loans from the institution he has increased his earnings because he has been able to buy wholesale.

The other members are Marlin, 30, who runs a grocery store in her home; Nubia, 62, who sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales] at home and as a street vendor in the capital; and Juan, 53, who sells tamales and bread in his community.

loans.use: to buy a quintal of corn, banana leaves, firewood, unrefined whole cane sugar, bags, etc.

loans.name: Jahovah Shamah Group

texts.en:
These members of the Jahovah Shamah Group live in Chorkor, one of the neighborhoods of Accra. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their businesses in Chorkor. They are small retail merchants, selling fish and kenkey (a cooked corn paste).

To increase their stock-in-trade, the group members decided to work with ID Ghana and are now on their fourth group loan cycle. They are applying for a 5,300 GHS loan to be apportioned among themselves.

Mary (the woman second from the right) is married to a fisherman, and they have three school-going children. She sells good fish at the local market. She intends to use her loan portion to buy three cartons of fish to sell to her customers, who come from all classes.

With this loan Mary hopes to reinvest her profits in her business and meet small household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy three cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. It is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake where many individuals make their living from fishing.

A few also work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay itself make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Jeremiah is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers; he also runs a small business selling shoes. The couple has been farming for fifteen years now, and they are currently growing maize, sorghum, vegetables and fruit on their farm.

This will be Jeremiah’s first loan with Honey Care. He is applying for a 17,100 KES loan to buy beehives and apiary materials. He is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey, it will provide him with honey for food and the bees will aid in pollinating his crops.

Jeremiah plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. His hope for the future is to have his children educated and to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. 

Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Charles, a father of eight, is a retired livestock officer, while his wife has been a farmer for 20 years now, currently growing maize, beans, sunflowers and trees on their farm. 

Charles is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey. This is his first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Charles’ hopes for the future are to have his children educated and to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат жительница столицы Республики Таджикистана города Душанбе. Ей 52 года. Она замужем и в браке имеет четверых детей. Муж находится за приделами страны на заработках. Старшим дочерям 27 и 19 лет. Они замужем и живут отдельно. Старшему сыну 15 лет, младшему 12 лет. Они учатся в средней школе. Назокат работает на дому. Она берет заказы на шитье женских платьев. Таким образом, она имеет дополнительный источник дохода. На сегодняшний день холодильник Назоката не пригоден для использования. Чтобы продукты не испортились, Назокат хочет приобрести новый холодильник, но не имеет достаточной суммы денег. Она решила обратиться за кредитом, с надеждой на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Nazokat is a resident of Dushanbe, the capital city of Tajikistan. She is 52 and married with four children. Her husband works abroad. Her oldest daughters are 27 and 19; both are married and live on their own. Her older son is 15 and the younger is 12. Both attend high school. Nazokat works at home sewing women's dresses to order, a business that provides her with an additional source of income. 

Nazokat's refrigerator is no longer working and she wants to buy a new one so that her groceries won't go bad, but she doesn't have enough money. She has decided to apply for a loan and waits hopefully for your support.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
Tatiana es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando para poder recibirse como una gran abogada, con lo cual podrá realizarse como persona y como profesional.
Su sueño es poder recibirse y trabajar de forma independiente, y poder abrir su estudio jurídico. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Tatiana is from the city of Carapeguá.  She's studying to be a great lawyer so she can fulfill herself personally and professionally.  Her dream is to get her degree and work independently and be able to open her law firm.

She's requesting this loan to invest in paying her fees.  This will be a big help to her and she'll be able to keep on studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Мунаввар и ее семья живут бедно, так как ее муж нигде не работает. Мунаввар 3 месяца назад начала свой бизнес разработкой и продажей абрикоса. Она покупает абрикосы, перерабатывает и продает на местном рынке. Она хочет укрепить бизнес и развеваться дальше. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Мунаввар запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки абрикоса для увеличения оборотного капитала нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munavvar is a cheerful woman of 40. She is married and has one child. Munavvar and her family live in poverty, since her husband doesn't work. Three months ago she started her own business processing and selling apricots. She buys them, processes them and sells them at the local market. She wants to strengthen her business and develop it further. With this goal in mind she has taken the course "Achieve Success" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Munavvar is requesting a loan of 3,500 somoni to buy apricots to increase the working capital of her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy apricots to increase the working capital of her new business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Florence is married and has six children. She runs a small business, while her husband is a farmer. He has been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, green grams, sorghum and sunflower. Florence is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Florence’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school for her children and cater for the basic needs of her family. Florence’s hope for the future is to have an economic change in her life from the additional income from her beekeeping project and to become a role model in beekeeping.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Judith is married and has ten children. Her husband runs a small business of buying and selling bananas. Both she and her husband practice farming. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing tomatoes, mangoes, bananas and sunflower in their farm. Judith got her interest in beekeeping from her parents who were beekeepers and she is excited about it as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and it will provide her with honey for food.

This is Judith’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Judith’s hope for the future is to have her children educated and to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Macy

texts.en:
Macy lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located at the south-western tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Macy is married and has five children. She runs a small business selling cereals and bananas, while her husband is a tailor. Both of them are farmers. They have been farming for five years now and they are currently growing maize, mangoes, sunflower and trees on their farm. Macy is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and it will provide her with honey for food.

This is Macy’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to improve her house, pay school fees for her children and cater for her family’s basic needs. Macy’s hope for the future is to live a better life from the income she will get from beekeeping.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Talent

texts.en: Talent is a 24-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothes for five months now. Talent was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to start a business so that she could become financially independent. She also volunteers delivering wellbeing sessions to students in schools that are within her community. With the requested loan from Kiva, Talent intends to buy more clothes and bags. With the additional profits, she intends to further her education by enrolling in a teacher’s college to train as a primary school teacher.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Proclamantine

texts.en:
Proclamantine is a 21-year-old mother of one living in the Gokwe South District of Zimbabwe. Proclamantine is very passionate about her community and assists the elderly to clean and do chores. She is also a Camfed Leaner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches life skills education to students. 
She has been running a poultry business successfully for over 19 months at her home and would like to see it expand. She started this as it was cheap to set up and now she is producing batches of 50 birds every six weeks and selling them to the local community members.
With the requested Kiva loan, Proclamantine will purchase feed, chicks and vaccines. With the additional profits, she hopes to expand her project into keeping egg layers. This will enable her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Agnes is married and has eight children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans and sunflowers on their farm. Agnes is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food.

This is Agnes’ first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to buy livestock. Agnes’ hope for the future is to expand her beekeeping project, increase her income and see her life change for the better.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Paulo is married and has ten children. He is a retired instructor in the Ministry of Applied Technology. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 30 years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, sorghum and cassava on their farm. Paulo is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for food.

This is Paulo’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to expand his beekeeping project. Paulo’s hope for the future is to have his family take up beekeeping.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located at the south-western tip of Kenya and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Magret is married and has six children. She runs a small business selling cereals. She also runs a small kiosk. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, ground nuts and sunflower. Magret is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project to undertake, it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and it has a ready market.

This is Magret’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to increase the stock for her small business. Magret’s hope for the future is to benefit from beekeeping and be a role model in beekeeping. She also hopes to improve her life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Rose is married and has ten children. She runs a small business of selling fish, while her husband runs a motorbike transport business. They also practice farming. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables and sunflower in their farm. Rose is excited about beekeeping as it is an easy project to undertake and it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food.

This is Rose’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Rose’s hope for the future is to have her children educated and to expand her beekeeping project and increase her honey production.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. It is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people. A market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay County often boasts traders from Ugandan, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares.

Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay County means that poverty rates are quite high, there is a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average.

Joseph is married and has eight children. Both he and his wife have been farming for fifteen years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, sunflowers and trees, plus keeping bees. Joseph is excited about enlarging his beekeeping operation, as he will earn extra money from the sale of honey and provide him with more honey for food and medicine.

This is Joseph’s first loan with Honey Care. He is applying for a 17,100 KES loan to buy new Langstroth hives and apiary materials to expand his beekeeping project. Joseph’s hope for the future is to have more beehives to increase his honey production and thus earn more income.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru:
Саноат жительница сельского района Гиссар. Последние 4 года она работает в дехканском хозяйстве брата, который имеет 10 га орошаемого участка земли. Саноат занимается там выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Она опытный фермер. Каждый год по сезонам она получает хороший урожай.    
Саноат 37 лет. Она разведена и имеет только одного ребенка. В данный момент посевы Саноат уже созрели и она хочет собрать их. Для сбора урожая Саноат будет привлекать наемных рабочих. Она берет кредит для оплаты за труд рабочих по сбору урожая. Этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en:
Sanoat is a resident of the rural region of Gissar. For the past four years she has been working on her brother's farm, a property that is 10 hectares in size. She works there growing crops. Sanoat is an experienced farmer and receives a good harvest every year.

Sanoat is 37 and divorced and has only one child. Her crops have already ripened and she wants to harvest them. For this she needs to hire workers, and she is taking out a loan to cover wages for bringing in the harvest. This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest her crops

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a 23-year-old businesswoman. She is a single mother with one child and lives in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running her own hairdressing business from her home for eight months now. When she is not working at her business, Salome serves as a Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member and volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in schools. With the requested loan from Kiva, she intends to make bulk purchases of rollers, hair extensions, hair sprays, hair relaxers, blowers and solar electricity so that she can offer more to her clients. With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a bigger hair salon and create employment within her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of rollers, hair extensions, hair sprays, hair relaxers, blowers and solar electricity

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en: Tendai is a 20-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothes and shoes for four months now. She was encouraged by other Cama (a network of graduates) members to venture into business so that she could provide for herself.  During her spare time, Tendai volunteers as a Learner Guide delivering well being sessions to students in schools. With the requested loan, Tendai intends to buy more clothes and shoes for all ages so that she can increase her sales and profits. With the additional profits she would be able to provide for herself and her siblings.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Antonater A

texts.en: Antonator is a 25-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling clothing for nearly two years. During her spare time, Antonator volunteers as a Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member providing peer education to the youth of her community.  With the requested loan, Antonator intends to buy her clothing from wholesalers at lower costs allowing her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy her clothing from wholesalers at lower costs allowing her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Tafadzwa

texts.en: Tafadzwa lives in the district of Zimbabwe with her family. She has been successfully selling second hand clothing and bags for five months now. Tafadzwa was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members and the Secretary of District Operations for Camfed to venture into business so that she could become financially independent. During her spare time, Tafadzwa volunteers as a Community Health Trainer at the local schools teaching students about health issues. With the requested loan Tafadzwa intends to buy more clothing and bags so that she can boost her sales and increase profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and bags so that she can boost her sales and increase profits.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en: Barbra is a 25-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully practicing horticulture for three months now. During her spare time, Barbra volunteers as a community health activist disseminating health information to the people of her community.  With the requested Kiva loan, she plans to buy more seeds, fertilizers and pesticides in order to grow more vegetables. With the additional profits, she intends to better provide for herself and her siblings.

loans.use: To buy more seeds, fertilizers ans pesticides

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is a 24-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully selling everyday items such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics and plastic ware from her home. She was encouraged by other Cama (a network of Camfed graduates) to start the business so that she could provide for herself. When she is not working, Belinda volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in schools within her community where she disseminates health information. With the requested loan, Belinda intends to make bulk purchases of the items she sells to boost her sales volume and increase profits. With increased profits, she hopes to expand into a retail business, create employment in her community and provide for her siblings.

loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk

loans.name: Adelick

texts.en: Adelick is a 24-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a poultry project for four months now. She produces batches of 25 broiler chickens every six weeks and was encouraged by other Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members to venture into business so that she could look after herself and her family. In her spare time, Adelick volunteers disseminating health information to her community. With the requested loan from Kiva, Adelick intends to buy more chicks, feed and feeding troughs to expand her fowl run. With the additional profits she intends to further her education and enroll in a nursing college to train as a midwife.

loans.use: to buy more chicks, feed and feeding troughs and expand her fowl run

loans.name: Aitupe

texts.en: Aitupe is a 40-year-old woman with one child. She has a small plantation business selling her produce to the members of her community and to the public. She has also started baking and selling pancakes as another means of earning income for her family. With this money she is getting, she plans to purchase chemicals, bush knives, a mist blower, and a blade sharpener to further improve her plantation, flour, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, and a wok for her pancake business. Aitupe has incurred the idea of helping out her family financially ever since she joined SPBD and she has managed to make a good profit out of her business. With the continuation of her success, she hopes to save a lot of money for home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, bushknives, a mist blower, a blade sharpener, flour, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, and a wok

loans.name: Lewnida

texts.en:
Lewnida lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay County is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Lewnida is a widow with nine children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for twenty years now, and she is currently growing maize, beans, green grams, sorghum and groundnuts. Lewnida is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey, because it is an easy project to undertake, and it has a ready market.

This is Lewnida’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Lewnida’s hope for the future is to invest in business and have an economic change in her life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн родился в 1987 году. Он живет и работает в отдаленном регионе. Хусейн женат, но не имеет детей. Он более 5 лет занимается бизнесом. Хусейн продает арбузы и дыни на местном рынке. Хусейн занимается бизнесом один и является единственным кормильцем, так как ее жена домохозяйка. Хусейн введет свой бизнес довольно успешно, так как население его кишлака каждый день покупают арбузы в жаркое время года. Он хочет увеличить оборотный капитал, так как в сезонное время потребность на его арбузы возрастает. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для покупки арбузов. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Huseyn was born in 1987. He lives and works in a remote region. He is married but has no children. For more than five years he has been running a business selling watermelon and other melons at the local market. He runs his business on his own and is the sole breadwinner in his family, as his wife is a homemaker. Huseyn's business is quite successful since the people in his village buy watermelon every day in this hot time of year. He wants to increase his working capital since demand for his watermelon increases seasonally. He is requesting a loan of US$800 to buy watermelon. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy watermelon to increase his working capital

loans.name: Flor Del Lago Santiago Group

texts.en:
Santiago Atitlan is a beautiful town on the shores of Lake Atitlan. Full of tourists exploring, locals bargaining at the market, and the smell of freshly made tortillas, the town is always buzzing with energy.  The seven women in the "Flor del Lago" trust bank have this energy. They meet monthly to share their ambitions, learn, and pay back a portion of the loan they have received. 

They put their children first. But they also have dreams for themselves. A member of the group is Maria, 45, says in the three years she has been working with Friendship Bridge, her small store has grown a lot. She works with her husband and together, they have seen great success. In her words “My business has grown and my personal life is good.”  She will use this loan to purchase inventory for the store such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles etc. She hopes to continue working with Friendship Bridge so she can continue to succeed and grow in her personal and business life. 

These women are full of ambition and positivity, despite hardships they have encountered in the past. The majority of the women in the Flor del Lago trust bank didn't have the chance to go to school at all, while others only received a primary education.  However, they all understand the importance of education and have dreams for their children. 

The Flor del Lago trust bank appreciate Friendship Bridge and Kiva investors because with their support, they are can laugh and smile and share their positive energy, in part because of the support they have received from Friendship Bridge and Kiva investors! Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase inventory for the store such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles etc.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a 22-year-old businesswoman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothing and shoes for all ages for two months. She started the business after realizing that she needed to financially assist her family. Today, apart from running her business, Brenda also volunteers as a Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) member helping the elderly in her community in their fields. With the requested loan Brenda intends to buy more clothing and shoes from wholesalers at lower cost so that she can become more competitive in the industry and boost her profit margins.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Thanh An 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chinh, 25, is team leader of Thanh An 2 Group, which consists of 19 members who are Thai minority. She currently lives with her husband and her daughter, aged of 5, in a new small Thai traditional house in a remote village. Like many people in the village, her family's income virtually relies on agricultural production, which includes cultivating rice, cassava, maize and breeding pigs, chickens, musk ducks. However, the earnings gained from agriculture are still merely enough for basic living so her husband works extra for local construction employers. 

Chinh said that, she not only has encountered the lack of capital but also the disease of chickens and musk ducks. For that reason, she decided to continue a second loan in Anh Chi Em Program after the success of raising and selling pigs from the first loan in the Program. This time, she would use the loan to buy chickens and musk ducks to expand breeding. She hopes that, with the support on finance and training of Anh Chi Em, she can enhance substantially the income for her family, then she could afford to buy some new furniture for the house and provide a more abundant life for her child. 

Chinh dreams that her child will be able to attend school fully and have a successful in career when she grows up. In the picture, she is smiling prettily and stands third from the right.

loans.use: to buy chickens and musk ducks to expand breeding

loans.name: Fue

texts.en: Fue is a 29-year-old woman with 2 children. She makes and sells pop corn and ice pops to the members of her community and also the school children. With this loan, she plans to purchase sugar, pop corn, cooking oil, plastic bags for her business. Fue has been a member of the SPBD program for 3 years now and she has managed meet her family's essential everyday needs with the profits she is getting from her small business. Fue hopes that if her good will continues, she would be able to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, pop corn, cooking oil and plastic bags

loans.name: Naite

texts.en:
Naite is 65 years old and married with four children. She has a small garden, where she grows taro, taamu, bananas, etc., which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than 5 years. Naite needs a loan to buy bush knives, a weed sprayer, fertilizers, a file, an axe, etc. 

Naite has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2010. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a weed sprayer, fertilizer, a file, an axe, etc.

loans.name: Tierra De Los Duraznos Group

texts.en:
Ten beautiful and happy women make up the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Tierra de los Duraznos,” or “Land of the Peaches,” located in the municipality of Chichicastenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. Here, there are acres of apple, plum and, of course, peach trees that the Trust Bank is named for. The ladies are a tightly knit group and share the common goal of leaving poverty behind, empowering themselves and improving their standard of living. Their average age is 39 years, and they have an average of two years of education. They have an average of four children.

Juana, who is 36 years of age with one year of formal education, is the current president of the Trust Bank. She is married with four children and has a small business selling undergarments for women, socks, hats and clothing for babies. She has a small storefront in the local market where she sells these items. Therefore, Juana is requesting a loan in order to purchase new merchandise to fill up her clothing store. Juana works harder than ever now because two of her children are in middle school, and her other two are about to complete primary school. Juana and her husband want to have enough income from the business to see the children complete their education because they realize how important it is for a successful and prosperous future.

The Trust Bank benefits greatly from the educational seminars given during the monthly meetings by a Friendshp Bridge Loan Officer. For some, this is the first opportunity they have had to learn about topics like nutrition, health, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. It is essential that they know about how to construct an effective business plan and manage their businesses, and so the seminars on budgeting, marketing, accounting, customer service and pricing are essential topics that are covered. They also learn about violence against women, self-esteem and women’s rights.

Friendship Bridge finds that the combination of the loans and education, called “Microcredit Plus” is a wonderful and effective way for the women to empower themselves and eliminate poverty. Kiva investors are greatly appreciated for their willingness and kindness to fund these small loans. We look forward to reporting on the women of the “Tierra de los Duraznos” Trust Bank in the very near future!

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise to fill up her clothing store.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is 18 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single and presently in his 3rd year in college taking up a Bachelor of Science in Criminology degree in one of the Universities in this province. For his education, he is supported by his mother who is a sari-sari store owner and also from his father, who is a farmer. The family is earning an approximate income of Php 4,500.00 per month. His brother also gives him financial support for his projects and other school expenses. Jessie is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition fee this semester. In the future, Jessie hopes to finish his course in order to be employed and help his parents.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en: Rolly works hard to sufficiently provide for his family, including descent living conditions. When he joined PMPC, he accessed needed capital for his small time business. Rolly has managed his business well and now he wants to work to renovate their house. He has applied for a loan to pay for the roofing materials. In the future, Rolly hopes to open a new store outlet in the nearby municipality.

loans.use: to pay for roofing materials

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a laptop and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Mitchelle

texts.en:
Mitchelle is an 18-year-old businesswoman living in Gokwe South District in Zimbabwe. She operates a small retail shop in her community, where she sells a variety of grocery products such as soap, eggs, sugar, flour, milk, juice, salt and mealie-meal. The store is conveniently located, since it is the only one in the vicinity. She started the business, as there was a ready market for the grocery items. Mitchelle’s earnings helped her provide an income for her family. 

She also volunteers in her community as a janitor, cleaning the toilets at the local clinic, and as a Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches students study and life skills.

The Kiva loan will enable Mitchelle to expand her business by increasing her stock and sales. She hopes to create employment in her community and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Luz Del Camino Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Luz del Camino,” or “Light of the Road," is located in a rural area of Chichicastenango called Chuchipaca in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. There are ladies in the Trust Bank who have various businesses such as traditional textile production, convenience stores, and small orchards where they grow peaches and apples.

Lidia is a 23-year-old secretary of the Trust Bank who is married with one small daughter. She has a “carnicería” or a meat store located in the community that was begun by her family several years ago. Lidia, along with her mother, is the current owner of the business. She has applied for a loan that she will use to purchase more fresh meat, as there is much demand in the area. Her customers would rather buy from her rather than traveling to the center of the town. Lidia is quite happy that she has such a faithful clientele because she looks forward to increasing her income and improving the lifestyle of her family.

Lidia and the ladies in the Trust Bank are most aware of the value of education. Most of them have had little or no formal education. Lidia is unique in the group because she has had nine years of formal education. She wants her daughter to have access to many years of formal education and is committed to creating a positive and healthy environment for the little girl. 

The women of the Trust Bank benefit from the educational component of their monthly meetings, when a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares valuable and practical information with them on how to successfully manage their loans, take care of their families, empower themselves and eliminate poverty in their lives.
