The combination of the educational piece and loans is what Friendship Bridge calls “Microcredit Plus.”

It is so important for these women to break the cycle of poverty and transform themselves and future generations of daughters, mothers, sisters, aunts, cousins and grandmothers. The “Microcredit Plus” program is a valuable way for the women of the “Luz del Camino” Trust Bank to light the road ahead and create a more prosperous future. Thank you, Kiva investors, for your generosity and kindness in funding these much-needed loans!

loans.use: To purchase more fresh meat to sell, as there is much demand in the area

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.en:
Santa Lucia La Reforma is a beautiful municipality in the Department of Totonicapán, in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The population of the area is 99% indigenous and speaks the Mayan dialect of Kiché. They have been described as people who are kind, responsible and hard working.

Seven women have organized themselves into a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank that they call “Las Golondrinas,” or “The Doves.” They are happy to apply for a new loan and begin a new loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. The ladies are also looking forward to the educational components of their monthly meetings, when they learn about how to manage their loans with information on effective business practices, accounting, budgeting, marketing and customer service. They can support their families more effectively as they learn about health, hygiene and how to get their children ready for school. And they learn about self-esteem, women’s rights and violence against women. “Microcredit Plus” is the name of the combination of the loans and educational seminars, and it is very effective.

Courage and a tremendous will to improve herself and move ahead describe Doña Ana, the married 23-year-old president of the Trust Bank who has one son. She is pregnant with her second child and wants to work hard to support the new member of the family. She has had four years of formal education. Several months ago, she opened up a “tortillería,” where she makes fresh tortillas three times each day. With her new loan, Ana would like to purchase corn and lime for her tortilla business as well as beans and gas. She has one employee who is most helpful.

Ana and the rest of the ladies of “Las Golondrinas” Trust Bank are committed to empowering themselves and eliminating poverty in their lives. Ana provides a strong and committed example of a Guatemalan indigenous woman who understands what she needs to do to move ahead. The ladies are very thankful that Kiva investors have learned about them because without these small loans, they would not be able to combat poverty and move ahead. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To purchase corn and lime for her tortilla business, as well as beans and gas.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria owns and operates a variety store to earn a living. She has been successful in this enterprise for many years and earns well from it. She has repaid her previous loan used for the business. and she also finds ways to improve her income.

Relative to this, Gloria is requesting a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 40,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, Gloria hopes to grow and to expand her business. She also desires a better life for her family.

Gloria meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and  draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to resell at her store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 61 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Carmen has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Tofaga

texts.en: Tofaga is a 23-year-old single mother of 2 children. She runs a small Elei business where she paints fabrics and sells them to the public. She has been doing this for 2 years now. With this money, Tofaga plans to purchase fabric paints, plywood, fabric, paint brushes, rolls, and print designs to continue to operate her business. She has found that she has been getting good profits from this business and she has managed to take care of her family's immediate needs. She hopes that she will be able to increase her productivity, so she can use a lot of her profits to improve the standards of living of her 2 children.

loans.use: to purchase fabric,  fabric paint, plywood, paint brushes, rolls, and print designs

loans.name: Giri Puteri Group

texts.en:
This group is happy because their pig-breeding businesses are doing well. The price for pork is quite high so now is a good time to sell all the pigs. All the members earn a satisfactory profit.
Ni Luh, as the treasurer, sold all of her pigs. Given a mixture feed, the pigs can grow healthy and fat. Now Ni Luh can fullfill her daily needs from her business with a little bit left for savings.
One of the members resigned because she followed husband to the city where he had a new job.
With only 10 members left, Giri Puteri group continues with another loan from MUK for the pig breeder program. They can obtain a loan without colateral and also get training to gain better knowledge of the pig business.
Ni Luh will use her loan to purchase five superior piglets for fattening and also purchase quality feed. She hopes her piglets can grow faster. She has plans to save all the profit for business capital.

loans.use: to purchase five superior piglets  and quality feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 63 years of age, and married with two children. Elizabeth is presently residing at Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for seven years now. She is a member in good standing. 

She requested a loan amount to purchase additional kilos of vegetables to sell. Elizabeth and her husband manage their business in the public market. They have had this business for more than 10 years. This is also their source of income daily. They are thankful that by Paglaum MPC, they can stabilize their business. Elizabeth and her family hope that they can expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en: Joselito signed up for his membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start a sari-sari store business. He is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like him. He was able to turn the tide in his favor and is making good sales these days. He wants to take advantage of his good fortune. Recently, he took a loan to restock his store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, he hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock his store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Carangan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María Santos tiene 50 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos y nietos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y aves de corral, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores que le permitirán generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Santos, 50, lives in her own house with her children and grandchildren in the Cayaltí district of Chiclayo Province, located in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

She makes a living selling alfalfa and fowl, and she has a lot of customers.  She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy small animals, which will allow her to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small animals

loans.name: Luis Edgardo

texts.es:
Luis Edgardo tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus tres hijos menores de edad dependientes, en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de limpieza, en una empresa del distrito, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cabritos y cerdos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores para engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mayor precio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Edgardo, 41, lives with his wife and his three dependent minor children in the Pucará district, located in Jaén Province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

He makes a living offering cleaning services in a company in the district.  He also raises small animals like hens, goats, and pigs.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy small animals to fatten and sell at a higher price.  That way he'll generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy small animals to fatten and sell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 59 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado, su cónyuge y tres menores hijos de 15, 9 y 6 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico ubicada en el Distrito de Santo Tomas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has sembrado de la variedad catimor, junto con su esposa también se dedican a la crianza de animales menores en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior a su vivienda, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para el mantenimiento de cultivo de café y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 59 years old, has his own home and lives with his wife and three children ages 15, 9 and 6 years old. Their house is rustic and is located in the district of Santo Tomas, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock. It is located in the province of Cutervo in the region Cajamarca, in the north of Peru. 

Juan Carlos grows coffee. He grows the catimor variety coffee bean and  with the help of his wife, he also raises small animals in a corral behind his home. He is asking for this loan in order to purchase fertilizer for his coffee crop so that he will be able to increase his earnings to benefit his family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for eight years, and she earns a good income from this business. Having responsibilities requires more effort, especially to provide for her two children. Marivic and her husband have had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Marivic would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With 25,000 PHP, she can purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely sends her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Marivic dreams of having a small grocery store. She also hopes for financial freedom for her family.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 46 years old, married, and has four children.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, coffee, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, detergent, soap, etc., to sell.

Emelia has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Emelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, coffee, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, detergent, soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Magunga, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay County is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflowers, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Margaret is married and has four children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now, and they are currently growing maize, beans, sorghum, groundnuts and sunflowers on their farm. Margaret is excited about beekeeping, as it is an easy enterprise to undertake, and it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food.

This is Margaret’s first loan with Honey Care. She plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children. Margaret’s hope for the future is to have her children educated and to have an economic change in her life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Faava

texts.en: Faava is a 31-year-old married woman, and the mother of one child. She wants to start a barbecue business and sell food to the members of the public, especially when she is located in town. That is why she joined the SPBD program, in order to gain access to financial assistance. Therefore, she plans to use this money to purchase a gas stove, small tent, cooler, cooking oil, and boxes of chicken leg quarters to start up her barbeque business. Faava plans to save as much of the profits as possible so that she can reinvest it back in her business and also help out in meeting her family's financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove, small tent, cooler, cooking oil, and boxes of chicken leg quarters

loans.name: Tirta Kusuma Group

texts.en:
Housewives in Bali maintain pigs at home to support the family and supplement their husbands' income. This is common for the Balinese people, especially those living in the village. To improve their skills and knowledge, they join a group. In addition to exchanging information, they also get loans because they do not have collateral that can be pledged to banks or other financial institutions to obtain loans. With the pig breeder program from MUK, I Gusti Nyoman of the Tirta Kusuma group feels pig farming could be developed for the welfare of the family.
I Gusti Nyoman is a grandmother with three sons and five grandsons. She just resigned from her job as a public servant at a government institution. She encouraged the women and men in her village to have better life and gain knowledge by joining the pig program from MUK. To improve their ability in terms of raising pigs and getting capital for businesses, they formed a group. I Gusti Nyoman will use the loan to buy two piglets and feed. After a six-month loan period, pigs will be ready to sell. The benefits of this effort will be used to support her family's economy and have some money available for savings.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
Lewelyn has owned and operated farmland, planting and harvesting bananas and other crops for sale for more than 12 years. She was able to provide for her family and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She earns well from her investments.

Lewelyn wants to improve her farm to ensure a better and greener farm. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time PHP 15,000, to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm.

She hopes to continually provide for the daily needs of the family through the farming business. She looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es:
Fabio es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, es una persona que se está esforzando por poder superarse, es por ello que está estudiando.
A la vez que estudia también trabaja, y de esa forma tiene los medios para poder ayudar cubrir sus gastos de la universidad. Estudia la carrera de Ingeniería comercial, y comenta que este préstamo lo quiere invertir en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad.
Tiene como meta poder, a través de sus estudios, poder ser gerente de una de las oficinas donde esté trabajando actualmente.
texts.en: Fabio lives in the city Caaguazu. He is working hard to get ahead. That is why he is going to school. He also works, and this allows him to cover university costs. He is studying commercial engineering and says that this loan will help him to pay for school. His goal is to be a manager one day in the offices where he currently works.

loans.use: pay university expenses.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in pig fattening for 2 years, and also earns additional income from running general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma settled to earn her living in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines together with her family. For over 20 years, Wilma has been able to help her husband to manage their own farm that absolutely met the needs of her family. Until now, the farm has still been doing well and giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With her generated revenue, she was able to save for their future needs. Recently, she took a new loan for additional capital for her rice production to buy fertilizer and seedlings. Wilma expects an increase in income to expand her farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Beth Dev

texts.en:
Beth Dev is married and a mother of five living in Buracan, Bonifacio with her family. Beth Dev owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income. Aside from this, she has a business buying newly harvested mangoes in bulk and vending the fruit in town. Beth Dev and her husband earn good income from this business so that she was able to repay her previous loans used for the business. Recently, she took out a new loan from GDMPC to buy additional newly harvested mangoes to resell.
In the future, Beth Dev wants to purchase another motorcycle to use in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional newly harvested mango to resell

loans.name: Luz Guadalupe

texts.es: Luz tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 12 años de edad. Luz es una mujer muy trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia lo necesario. Luz se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de forma ambulante desde hace tres años. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de las paredes de su vivienda dado que por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, hierro, lámina galvanizada, y pagará la mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en:
Luz is 26 years old and lives in her own house with her life companion and 12 year old child. She is a very hardworking woman who is doing all within her power to give her family what they need. Luz has been a street vendor selling natural products for three years.

Hoping to better her living conditions, she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in building walls for her dwelling because they are unfinished  due to a lack of financial resources. She will purchase cement, sand, iron and galvanized sheets with the sum requested and pay the costs of labor to do the construction.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, galvanized sheets and pay a labor force to construct the walls of her dwelling.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería, trabaja como empleada doméstica, y de esa forma estudia y trabaja a la vez.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante y poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad de estudiar que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Ana is a nursing student and works as a domestic employee, thus she both studies and works at the same time.

She is a very hardworking person who is making an effort to get ahead and to be in a position to help her family through her studies.

She is requesting this loan to pay her school fees so that she can continue with her current studies. She is grateful for this opportunity she has to attend school.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
This is Rosaly. She previously accessed a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in covering the children’s education and their personal, household and business expenditures.

Rosaly would like to apply for a new 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better! More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosaly hopes to improve her business profit and revenue. She wants her children to be able to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Gertrudes

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Gertrudes works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Gertrudes is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Gertrudes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ni Putu

texts.en: Ni Putu, 33, lives with her husband and two school-age sons. Besides being a housewife, she is managing a pig-raising business. Currently, Ni Putu has four sows and seven fattening. Although the business is still small in scale, it is enough to help provide for her family. The waste generated from the pig business has not been fully used and causes more pollution. After being informed about the management of sewage waste into biogas, Ni Putu enthusiastically followed because of the many positive impacts that can be obtained from biogas as an environmentally friendly energy and organic fertilizer. She joined the program and used her loan as capital for the pig business and to build a biogas reactor. She hopes she is able to get maximum results from the business and take part in environmental conservation efforts as well as being a model for surrounding communities.

loans.use: To build a biogas reactor

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KIMOYGANAKERA MAGANIROIGI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Marcos se dedica al negocio de agricultura, el socio tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra café y platanos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Kimoyganakera Maganiroigi" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Echarate in La Convención province and the department of Cusco.

Marcos' business is agriculture. He has a plot of land where he grows coffee and bananas. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. He has already been doing this work for several years and it is going very well for him. His dream is to expand his agriculture business. He is asking for the loan to buy seed and fertilizer.

He wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting his family in this way. This loan is part of one of Asociación Arariwa's credit lines called Credi Yapa. This credit line is given to borrowers with a good credit history.

He is happy for the loan and promises to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Valle De Las Americas Group

texts.es: El grupo está conformado por cuatro socios dirigido por el señor Camilo con 27 años de edad, acompañado dependiendo de él un hijo de tres anos de edad, ofrece el servicio de transporte en su comunidad, es propietario de una Moto taxi, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en mejoras de la moto taxi como es llantas y pinturas. Las otras socias son las señoras,  Esperanza de 34 años de edad quien vende tamales pisques desde hace quince años en el mercado de Granada, Claudia de 22 años de edad se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, tamales rellenos y tortillas en el mercado de Granada, Carlota de 42 años de edad, vende vigoron, gaseosas, leche y café en el mercado de Granada.
texts.en:
The group is made up of four members led by Sr. Camilo, who is 27 years old and has a partner and a 3 year old child, dependent on him. He provides transportation services in his community and owns a motorcycle taxi. 

Camilo is requesting a loan to invest in improvements on his motorcycle taxi, such as tires and painting.

The other members of the group are Esperanza, 34 years old, who has been selling “tamales pisques” for 15 years at the Granada market, Claudia, 22 years old, who sells ““nacatamales,” “tamales rellenos” y torillas at the Granada market and Carlota, 42 years old, who sells “vigoron,” soft drinks, milk and coffee at the Granada market.

loans.use: to purchase tires and paint.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо живет в городе Душанбе. Она замужем. У нее имеется трое детей. Два сына и дочка. Мархабо 43 года. Она более 10 лет занимается шитьем национальной одежды на заказ. Она любит свою работу  и намерена продолжить деятельность. Ее машинка сломалась и по этой причине она берет кредит. Она хочет на сумму займа приобрести новую швейную машинку. Из-за того что у нее не хватает средств, она решила получить кредит, чтобы заменить старую на новую швейную машинку.
texts.en: Marhabo lives in the town of Dushanbe. She is married. She has three children: two sons and one daughter. Marhabo is 43 years old. She has been sewing made-to-order traditional national clothing. She enjoys her work and intends to continue her business. Her old swing machine is broken, which is why she is taking out a loan. She would like to use her loan to buy a new sewing machine. As she lacks her own funds she decided to apply for a loan in order to replace her old sewing machine.

loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es: Teodolinda tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y un hijo. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza mucho por su familia. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y a la venta de productos por catalogo.  Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena y grava para repellar las paredes y para encementar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en: Teodolinda is 39 years old, married, and the mother of one child; she works extremely hard to support her family. She lives with her husband and son in the family's own home. Teodolinda has for many years worked cleaning homes and selling goods from catalogs. She has decided to apply for this loan from FUSAI because she wants to make improvements to her home. She will use the loan funds to purchase cement, sand, and gravel to plaster the walls and install a cement floor in the home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and gravel to plaster the walls and install a cement floor in her home.

loans.name: Tunas Jaya Group

texts.en:
Tunas Jaya group is a new pig farmer group with 10 members. They are taking a loan of 16.500.000 IDR. They joined in a group to get funding and training from MUK. They received information about pig groups from the group at another village.

Ni Komang is a housewife. Besides being a pig breeder, she has a small kiosk in front of her house. Her husband works as a farmer. In addition to helping her husband as a farmer, Ni Komang raises pigs. With the loan, she bought two piglets for fattening. She plans to be a piglet seller. Ni Komang hopes to be able to fix her house with the profits from raising pigs.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets for fattening

loans.name: Dante Quimer

texts.es:
Dante Quimer tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería-fumigación, contando con herramientas propias, con experiencia en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas y un nuevo equipo de fumigación que le permita brindar en mejores condiciones su trabajo.
texts.en:
Dante Quimer is 35 years old. He lives in the Oyotún district, a community dedicated to agriculture, business, and ranching located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He provides services as a day laborer in fumigation and has his own tools and experience in the business. He has requested a loan of 1200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy tools and a new fumigation unit that will allow him to work in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools and a new fumigation unit that will allow him to work in better conditions.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Emie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Emie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Emie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia es una chica luchadora, que está trabajando para poder estudiar, su deseo es crear algún día una fundación en su ciudad para los jóvenes que al igual que ella quieran estudiar.
Está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, y comenta que aunque tenga muchos vaivenes, lo está superando con su esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte, ya que día a día tiene que viajar en el ómnibus, lo cual implica un gasto un poco elevado del día a día. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Sofia is a tenacious young woman who is working so that she'll be able to study. Her dream is to someday start a foundation in her city that will help children like her who want to pursue an education. 

Sofia is studying business administration and says that although she experiences many ups and downs, her efforts are paying off and she's doing well in school. Sofia is applying for this loan to cover her transportation costs; she commutes each day on a bus, which adds to her daily expenses. She is very grateful for the help that this loan will provide her.

loans.use: to pay transportation costs.
